name_en: The command to level the grave

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ تَجْصِيصِ الْقَبْرِ، وَالْبِنَاءِ، عَلَيْهِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of plastering graves or erecting structures over them

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْجُلُوسِ، عَلَى الْقَبْرِ وَالصَّلاَةِ عَلَيْهِ ‏‏
name_en: Prohibition against sitting and praying on graves

name_ar: باب الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الْجَنَازَةِ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ ‏‏
name_en: Offering the funeral prayer in the masjid

name_ar: باب مَا يُقَالُ عِنْدَ دُخُولِ الْقُبُورِ وَالدُّعَاءِ لأَهْلِهَا ‏‏
name_en: What is to be said when entering the graveyard and supplicating for its occupants

name_ar: باب اسْتِئْذَانِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم رَبَّهُ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ فِي زِيَارَةِ قَبْرِ أُمِّهِ ‏‏
name_en: The prophet (ﷺ) asked his Lord for permission to visit the grave of his mother

name_ar: باب تَرْكِ الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الْقَاتِلِ نَفْسَهُ ‏‏
name_en: Leaving the funeral prayer for one who committed suicide

name_ar: باب مَا فِيهِ الْعُشْرُ أَوْ نِصْفُ الْعُشْرِ ‏‏
name_en: On what one-tenth or half of one-tenth is due

name_ar: باب لاَ زَكَاةَ عَلَى الْمُسْلِمِ فِي عَبْدِهِ وَفَرَسِهِ ‏‏
name_en: The Muslim is not obliged to give Zakat on his slave nor his horse

name_ar: باب فِي تَقْدِيمِ الزَّكَاةِ وَمَنْعِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Paying or withholding Zakat

name_ar: باب زَكَاةِ الْفِطْرِ عَلَى الْمُسْلِمِينَ مِنَ التَّمْرِ وَالشَّعِيرِ ‏‏
name_en: Zakat Al-Fitr is due from the muslims in the form of dates and barley

name_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِإِخْرَاجِ زَكَاةِ الْفِطْرِ قَبْلَ الصَّلاَةِ ‏‏
name_en: The command to pay Zakat Al-Fitr before the prayer

name_ar: باب إِثْمِ مَانِعِ الزَّكَاةِ ‏‏
name_en: The sin of one who withholds Zakat

name_ar: باب إِرْضَاءِ السُّعَاةِ ‏‏
name_en: Pleasing the Su'ah (Zakat Collectors)

name_ar: باب تَغْلِيظِ عُقُوبَةِ مَنْ لاَ يُؤَدِّي الزَّكَاةَ ‏‏
name_en: Severe Punishment for the one who does not pay Zakat

name_ar: باب التَّرْغِيبِ فِي الصَّدَقَةِ ‏‏
name_en: Encouragement to give Charity

name_ar: باب فِي الْكَنَّازِينَ لِلأَمْوَالِ وَالتَّغْلِيظِ عَلَيْهِمْ ‏‏
name_en: Stern warning concerning those who hoard wealth

name_ar: باب الْحَثِّ عَلَى النَّفَقَةِ وَتَبْشِيرِ الْمُنْفِقِ بِالْخَلَفِ ‏‏
name_en: Encouragement to spend and glad tidings of compensation for the one who spends on good deeds

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ النَّفَقَةِ عَلَى الْعِيَالِ وَالْمَمْلُوكِ وَإِثْمِ مَنْ ضَيَّعَهُمْ أَوْ حَبَسَ نَفَقَتَهُمْ عَنْهُمْ
name_en: The virtue of spending on one's family and slaves, and the sin of the one who neglects them or withholds maintenance from them

name_ar: باب الاِبْتِدَاءِ فِي النَّفَقَةِ بِالنَّفْسِ ثُمَّ أَهْلِهِ ثُمَّ الْقَرَابَةِ ‏‏
name_en: Starting with oneself, then one's family, then one's relatives, when spending

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ النَّفَقَةِ وَالصَّدَقَةِ عَلَى الْأَقْرَبِينَ وَالزَّوْجِ وَالْأَوْلَادِ وَالْوَالِدَيْنِ وَلَوْ كَانُوا مُشْرِكِينَ
name_en: The virtue of spending and giving charity to relatives, spouses, children and parents, even if they are idolaters

name_ar: باب وُصُولِ ثَوَابِ الصَّدَقَةِ عَنِ الْمَيِّتِ، إِلَيْهِ ‏‏
name_en: Charity given on behalf of the deceased will reach him

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ اسْمَ الصَّدَقَةِ يَقَعُ عَلَى كُلِّ نَوْعٍ مِنَ الْمَعْرُوفِ ‏‏
name_en: The word charity (Sadaqah) may apply to all good deeds Ma'ruf

name_ar: باب فِي الْمُنْفِقِ وَالْمُمْسِكِ ‏‏
name_en: The one who spends and the one who withholds

name_ar: باب التَّرْغِيبِ فِي الصَّدَقَةِ قَبْلَ أَنْ لاَ يُوجَدَ مَنْ يَقْبَلُهَا ‏‏
name_en: Encouragement to give charity before there is no one to accept it

name_ar: باب قَبُولِ الصَّدَقَةِ مِنَ الْكَسْبِ الطَّيِّبِ وَتَرْبِيَتِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Acceptance of charity that comes from good (Tayyib) earnings, and the growth thereof

name_ar: باب الْحَثِّ عَلَى الصَّدَقَةِ وَلَوْ بِشِقِّ تَمْرَةٍ أَوْ كَلِمَةٍ طَيِّبَةٍ وَأَنَّهَا حِجَابٌ مِنْ النَّارِ
name_en: Encouragement to give charity even if it is with half a date or a kind word. And charity is a shield against the fire.

name_ar: باب الْحَمْلِ بِأُجْرَةٍ يُتَصَدَّقُ بِهَا وَالنَّهْىِ الشَّدِيدِ عَنْ تَنْقِيصِ الْمُتَصَدِّقِ بِقَلِيل
name_en: Carrying goods for payment and giving charity out of one's wages, and the stern prohibition of belittling the one who gives something small in charity

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْمَنِيحَةِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of giving gifts

name_ar: باب مَثَلِ الْمُنْفِقِ وَالْبَخِيلِ ‏‏
name_en: The Likeness of the giver and the miser

name_ar: باب ثُبُوتِ أَجْرِ الْمُتَصَدِّقِ وَإِنْ وَقَعَتِ الصَّدَقَةُ فِي يَدِ غَيْرِ أَهْلِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Confirmation of the reward of the one who gives Charity, even if the Charity ends up in the hands of an evildoer, and the like

name_ar: باب أَجْرِ الْخَازِنِ الأَمِينِ وَالْمَرْأَةِ إِذَا تَصَدَّقَتْ مِنْ بَيْتِ زَوْجِهَا غَيْرَ مُفْسِدَةٍ ب
name_en: The reward of the Trustworthy Trustee, and if a woman gives charity from her husband's house without causing any damage, with his explicit or implicit permission

name_ar: باب مَا أَنْفَقَ الْعَبْدُ مِنْ مَالِ مَوْلاَهُ ‏‏
name_en: What a slave spends of his master's wealth

name_ar: باب مَنْ جَمَعَ الصَّدَقَةَ وَأَعْمَالَ الْبِرِّ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of the one who does other kinds of good deeds in addition to giving charity

name_ar: باب الْحَثِّ فِي الإِنْفَاقِ وَكَرَاهَةِ الإِحْصَاءِ ‏‏
name_en: Encouragement to spend, and it is disliked to count how much

name_ar: باب الْحَثِّ عَلَى الصَّدَقَةِ وَلَوْ بِالْقَلِيلِ وَلاَ تُمْتَنَعُ مِنَ الْقَلِيلِ لاِحْتِقَارِهِ ‏
name_en: Encouragement to give in charity even if it is a little, and a little should not be withheld because one thinks it is too little

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ إِخْفَاءِ الصَّدَقَةِ ‏
name_en: The virtue of concealing (what is given in) charity

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ أَفْضَلَ الصَّدَقَةِ صَدَقَةُ الصَّحِيحِ الشَّحِيحِ ‏
name_en: The best of charity is that which is given when one is healthy and inclined to be stingy

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الْيَدَ الْعُلْيَا خَيْرٌ مِنْ الْيَدِ السُّفْلَى وَأَنَّ الْيَدَ الْعُلْيَا هِيَ الْمُنْفِقَةُ وَأَنَّ السُّفْلَى هِيَ الْآخِذَةُ
name_en: The upper hand is better than the lower hand, and the upper hand is the one that gives and the lower hand is the one that receives

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْمَسْأَلَةِ ‏
name_en: The prohibition of Begging

name_ar: باب الْمِسْكِينِ الَّذِي لاَ يَجِدُ غِنًى وَلاَ يُفْطَنُ لَهُ فَيُتَصَدَّقَ عَلَيْهِ ‏
name_en: The poor person who cannot find enough to make him independent of means, but the people do not realize that he is in need, so they do not give Charity to him

name_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الْمَسْأَلَةِ لِلنَّاسِ ‏
name_en: It is disliked to beg from people

name_ar: باب مَنْ تَحِلُّ لَهُ الْمَسْأَلَةُ ‏
name_en: The one for whom it is permissible to ask for help

name_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ الأَخْذِ لِمَنْ أُعْطِيَ مِنْ غَيْرِ مَسْأَلَةٍ وَلاَ إِشْرَافٍ ‏
name_en: It is permissible to take without asking for it or hoping for it

name_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الْحِرْصِ عَلَى الدُّنْيَا ‏
name_en: It is disliked to be eager to acquire worldly gains

name_ar: باب لَوْ أَنَّ لاِبْنِ آدَمَ وَادِيَيْنِ لاَبْتَغَى ثَالِثًا ‏
name_en: If the Son of Adam had two valleys, he would desire a third

name_ar: باب لَيْسَ الْغِنَى عَنْ كَثْرَةِ الْعَرَضِ
name_en: The virtue of contentment and encouragement thereof

name_ar: باب تَخَوُّفِ مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْ زَهْرَةِ الدُّنْيَا ‏
name_en: Warning against being deceived by the splendor and luxury of this world

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ التَّعَفُّفِ وَالصَّبْرِ ‏
name_en: The virtue of refraining from asking and being patient and content

name_ar: باب فِي الْكَفَافِ وَالْقَنَاعَةِ ‏
name_en: Sufficient provision and contentment

name_ar: باب إِعْطَاءِ مَنْ سَأَلَ بِفُحْشٍ وَغِلْظَةٍ ‏
name_en: Giving to those whose hearts have been inclined (towards Islam) and to those for whose faith there is fear if they are not given anything, and putting up with the one who asks rudely due to ignorance, and the Khawarij and rulings regarding them

name_ar: باب إِعْطَاءِ مَنْ يُخَافُ عَلَى إِيمَانِهِ ‏
name_en: Giving to one whose faith one fears

name_ar: باب إِعْطَاءِ الْمُؤَلَّفَةِ قُلُوبُهُمْ عَلَى الإِسْلاَمِ وَتَصَبُّرِ مَنْ قَوِيَ إِيمَانُهُ ‏
name_en: Giving to those whose hearts have been inclined (towards Islam) and urging those whose faith is strong to show patience

name_ar: باب ذِكْرِ الْخَوَارِجِ وَصِفَاتِهِمْ ‏
name_en: The Khawarij and their attributes

name_ar: باب التَّحْرِيضِ عَلَى قَتْلِ الْخَوَارِجِ ‏
name_en: Exhortation to kill the Khawarij

name_ar: باب الْخَوَارِجُ شَرُّ الْخَلْقِ وَالْخَلِيقَةِ ‏
name_en: The Khawarij are the most evil of people and of all creation

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الزَّكَاةِ عَلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ وَعَلَى آلِهِ وَهُمْ بَنُو هَاشِمٍ وَبَنُو الْمُطَّلِبِ دُونَ غَيْرِهِمْ
name_en: Zakat is forbidden for the messenger of Allah pbuh and his family, and they are Banu Hashim and Banu Al-Muttalib, and no one else

name_ar: باب تَرْكِ اسْتِعْمَالِ آلِ النَّبِيِّ عَلَى الصَّدَقَةِ ‏
name_en: Not appointing the family of the prophet (ﷺ) in charge of charity

name_ar: باب إِبَاحَةِ الْهَدِيَّةِ لِلنَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَلِبَنِي هَاشِمٍ وَبَنِي الْمُطَّلِبِ
name_en: Gifts are permissible for the Prophet (ﷺ) and Banu Hashim and Banu Al-Muttalib, even if the giver acquired it by way of charity. When the recipient takes possession of Charity, it is no longer described as charity, and it is permissible for anyone for whom charity is otherwise unlawful

name_ar: باب قَبُولِ النَّبِيِّ الْهَدِيَّةَ وَرَدِّهِ الصَّدَقَةَ ‏‏
name_en: The prophet (ﷺ) accepted gifts but refused Charity

name_ar: باب الدُّعَاءِ لِمَنْ أَتَى بِصَدَقَتِهِ ‏‏
name_en: The supplication for the one who brings Charity

name_ar: باب إِرْضَاءِ السَّاعِي مَا لَمْ يَطْلُبْ حَرَامًا ‏‏
name_en: Pleasing the Zakat Collector unless he asks for something unlawful

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ ‏‏
name_en: The Virtues of the month of Ramadan

name_ar: بَاب وُجُوبِ صَوْمِ رَمَضَانَ لِرُؤْيَةِ الْهِلَالِ وَالْفِطْرِ لِرُؤْيَةِ الْهِلَالِ وَأَنَّهُ إِذَا غُمَّ فِي أَوَّلِهِ أَوْ آخِرِهِ أُكْمِلَتْ عِدَّةُ الشَّهْرِ ثَلَاثِينَ يَوْمًا
name_en: The obligation to fast Ramadan when the crescent is sighted, and to break the fast when the crescent is sighted, and that if it is cloudy at the beginning or end of the month, then the month should be completed as thirty days.

name_ar: باب لاَ تَقَدَّمُوا رَمَضَانَ بِصَوْمِ يَوْمٍ وَلاَ يَوْمَيْنِ ‏‏
name_en: Do not start fasting one or two days before Ramadan

name_ar: باب الشَّهْرُ يَكُونُ تِسْعًا وَعِشْرِينَ ‏‏
name_en: The month may be twenty-nine days

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ لِكُلِّ بَلَدٍ رُؤْيَتَهُمْ وَأَنَّهُمْ إِذَا رَأَوْا الْهِلَالَ بِبَلَدٍ لَا يَثْبُتُ حُكْمُهُ لِمَا بَعُدَ عَنْهُمْ
name_en: Each land has its own sighting of the moon, and if they see the crescent in one land, that does not necessarily apply to regions that are far away from it

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّهُ لَا اعْتِبَارَ بِكُبْرِ الْهِلَالِ وَصِغَرِهِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ تَعَالَى أَمَدَّهُ لِلرُّؤْيَةِ فَإِنْ غُمَّ فَلْيُكْمَلْ ثَلَاثُونَ
name_en: Clarifying that it does not matter whether the crescent is large or small, for Allah, the Most High, causes it to appear for long enough that people can see it, and if it is cloudy then thirty days should be completed

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ مَعْنَى قَوْلِهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ شَهْرَا عِيدٍ لَا يَنْقُصَانِ
name_en: The meaning of the Prophet's words: "The two months of 'Id cannot both be incomplete"

name_ar: بَاب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الدُّخُولَ فِي الصَّوْمِ يَحْصُلُ بِطُلُوعِ الْفَجْرِ وَأَنَّ لَهُ الْأَكْلَ وَغَيْرَهُ حَتَّى يَطْلُعَ الْفَجْرُ وَبَيَانِ صِفَةِ الْفَجْرِ الَّذِي تَتَعَلَّقُ بِهِ الْأَحْكَامُ مِنْ الدُّخُولِ فِي الصَّوْمِ وَدُخُولِ وَقْتِ صَلَاةِ الصُّبْحِ وَغَيْرِ ذَلِكَ
name_en: Clarifying that fasting begins at dawn, and a person may eat and other than that until dawn begins; And clarifying the dawn which has to do with the rulings concerning the beginning of fasting and the beginning of the time for the Subh Prayer, and other than that, which is the Second Dawn, which is called the True Dawn. The First Dawn, which is the False Dawn, has nothing to do with the rulings

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ السُّحُورِ وَتَأْكِيدِ اسْتِحْبَابِهِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ تَأْخِيرِهِ وَتَعْجِيلِ الْفِطْرِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of sahur, which is recommended. It is recommended to delay it and to hasten the breaking of the fast

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ وَقْتِ انْقِضَاءِ الصَّوْمِ وَخُرُوجِ النَّهَارِ ‏‏
name_en: Clarifying the time for ending the fast and the end of the day

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْوِصَالِ، فِي الصَّوْمِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of Al-Wisal

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الْقُبْلَةَ فِي الصَّوْمِ لَيْسَتْ مُحَرَّمَةً عَلَى مَنْ لَمْ تُحَرِّكْ شَهْوَتَهُ ‏‏
name_en: Clarifying that Kissing when fasting is not unlawful for the one whose desire is not provoked by that

name_ar: باب صِحَّةِ صَوْمِ مَنْ طَلَعَ عَلَيْهِ الْفَجْرُ وَهُوَ جُنُبٌ ‏‏
name_en: The fasting is valid for the one who is Junub when dawn comes

name_ar: باب تَغْلِيظِ تَحْرِيمِ الْجِمَاعِ فِي نَهَارِ رَمَضَانَ عَلَى الصَّائِمِ وَوُجُوبِ الْكَفَّارَةِ الْكُبْرَى فِيهِ وبيانها وأنها تجب على الموسر والمعسر وتثبت في ذمة المعسر حتى يستطيع
name_en: The strict prohibition of intercourse during the day in Ramadan for one who is fasting; And the obligation of offering major expiation and the definition thereof; And that it is obligatory for both the one who can afford it and the one who cannot afford it, and it remains an obligation for the one who cannot afford it until he has the means

name_ar: باب جواز الصوم والفطر في شهر رمضان للمسافر في غير معصية إذا كان سفره مرحلتين فأكثر وأن الأفضل لمن أطاقه بلا ضرر أن يصوم ولمن يشق عليه أن يفطر
name_en: It is permissible to fast or not to fast during Ramadan for one who is travelling for no sinful purpose, if his journey is two stages or further. But it is better for the one who is able to fast without suffering any harm to do so, and the one for whom it is difficult may break the fast

name_ar: باب أَجْرِ الْمُفْطِرِ فِي السَّفَرِ إِذَا تَوَلَّى الْعَمَلَ ‏‏
name_en: The reward of the one who does not fast when travelling if he does any tasks that are required

name_ar: باب التَّخْيِيرِ فِي الصَّوْمِ وَالْفِطْرِ فِي السَّفَرِ ‏‏
name_en: The choice between fasting and not fasting when travelling

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الْفِطْرِ لِلْحَاجِّ بِعَرَفَاتٍ يَوْمَ عَرَفَةَ ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended for the person performing Hajj in 'Arafat not to fast on the day of 'Arafah.

name_ar: باب صَوْمِ يَوْمِ عَاشُورَاءَ ‏‏
name_en: Fasting on the day of Ashura'

name_ar: باب أَىُّ يَوْمٍ يُصَامُ فِي عَاشُورَاءَ ‏‏
name_en: Which day should be fasted for 'Ashura?

name_ar: باب مَنْ أَكَلَ فِي عَاشُورَاءَ فَلْيَكُفَّ بَقِيَّةَ يَوْمِهِ ‏‏
name_en: Whoever eats on Ashura, let him refrain (from eating) for the rest of the day

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ صَوْمِ، يَوْمِ الْفِطْرِ وَيَوْمِ الأَضْحَى ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of fasting on the two days of 'Id

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ صَوْمِ أَيَّامِ التَّشْرِيقِ ‏
name_en: The prohibition of fasting the days of At-Tashriq, which are the days of eating, drinking and remembering Allah, The Mighty and Sublime

name_ar: باب كَرَاهِيَةِ صِيَامِ يَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ مُنْفَرِدًا
name_en: It is disliked to single out Friday for fasting, unless it coincides with a day that one customarily fasts

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ نَسْخِ قَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى ‏{‏ وَعَلَى الَّذِينَ يُطِيقُونَه} فِدْيَةٌ بِقَوْلِهِ فَمَنْ شَهِدَ مِنْكُمْ الشَّهْرَ فَلْيَصُمْهُ
name_en: The Saying of Allah Most High: "... And as for those who can fast with difficulty, they have) a choice either to fast or) to feed a Miskin (poor person) (for every day)" is Abrogated by His saying: "... So whoever of you sights (the crescent on the first night of) the month (of Ramadan i.e. is present at his home), he must observe Sawm (fasts) that month"...

name_ar: باب قَضَاءِ رَمَضَانَ فِي شَعْبَانَ ‏
name_en: It is Permissible to delay making up missed Ramadan Fasts until before the next Ramadan comes, and this is for those who broke the fast for a reason such as sickness, travel, menstruation and the like

name_ar: باب قَضَاءِ الصِّيَامِ عَنِ الْمَيِّتِ
name_en: Making up fasts on behalf of the deceased

name_ar: باب الصَّائِمِ يُدْعَى لِطَعَامٍ أَوْ يُقَاتَلُ فَلْيَقُلْ إِنِّي صَائِمٌ ‏
name_en: If a fasting person is invited to eat and he does not want to break his fast, or someone insults him or argues with him, it is recommended for him to say: "I am Fasting", and he should protect his fast from obscene speech, ignorance and the like

name_ar: باب حِفْظِ اللِّسَانِ لِلصَّائِمِ ‏
name_en: Guarding One's Tongue when Fasting

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الصِّيَامِ ‏
name_en: The Virtue of Fasting

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الصِّيَامِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ لِمَنْ يُطِيقُهُ بِلاَ ضَرَرٍ وَلاَ تَفْوِيتِ حَقٍّ ‏
name_en: The Virtue of Fasting for in the cause of Allah, for those who are able to without suffering any harm or neglecting other duties

name_ar: بَاب جَوَازِ صَوْمِ النَّافِلَةِ بِنِيَّةٍ مِنْ النَّهَارِ قَبْلَ الزَّوَالِ وَجَوَازِ فِطْرِ الصَّائِمِ نَفْلًا مِنْ غَيْرِ عُذْرٍ
name_en: It is permissible to observe a voluntary fast with an intention formed during the day before the sun reaches its Zenith, and it is permissible for one who is observing a voluntary fast to break his fast with no excuse, although it is better for him to complete it

name_ar: باب أَكْلُ النَّاسِي وَشُرْبُهُ وَجِمَاعُهُ لاَ يُفْطِرُ ‏
name_en: The one who eats, drinks, or has intercourse by mistake does not break his fast

name_ar: بَاب صِيَامِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ فِي غَيْرِ رَمَضَانَ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ أَنْ لَا يُخْلِيَ شَهْرًا عَنْ صَوْمٍ
name_en: The Prophet's Fasts at times other than Ramadan; and it is recommended to ensure that no month is free of fasting

name_ar: بَاب النَّهْيِ عَنْ صَوْمِ الدَّهْرِ لِمَنْ تَضَرَّرَ بِهِ أَوْ فَوَّتَ بِهِ حَقًّا أَوْ لَمْ يُفْطِرْ الْعِيدَيْنِ وَالتَّشْرِيقَ وَبَيَانِ تَفْضِيلِ صَوْمِ يَوْمٍ وَإِفْطَارِ يَوْمٍ
name_en: Prohibition of Fasting for a lifetime for the one who will be harmed by that or who will neglect other duties, or does not break his fast on the two 'Ids or during the days of At-Tashriq; It is better to fast alternate days

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ صِيَامِ ثَلَاثَةِ أَيَّامٍ مِنْ كُلِّ شَهْرٍ وَصَوْمِ يَوْمِ عَرَفَةَ وَعَاشُورَاءَ وَالِاثْنَيْنِ وَالْخَمِيسِ
name_en: It is recommended to fast three days of every month, and to fast on the days of 'Arafah and 'Ashura', and to fast on Mondays and Thursdays

name_ar: باب صَوْمِ سَرَرِ شَعْبَانَ ‏
name_en: Fasting at the end of Sha'ban

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ صَوْمِ الْمُحَرَّمِ ‏
name_en: The virtue of fasting Muharram

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ صَوْمِ سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ مِنْ شَوَّالٍ اتِّبَاعًا لِرَمَضَانَ ‏
name_en: It is recommended to fast Six Days in Shawwal following Ramadan

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ وَالْحَثِّ عَلَى طَلَبِهَا وَبَيَانِ مَحَلِّهَا وَأَرْجَى أَوْقَاتِ طَلَبِهَا
name_en: The virtue of Lailat Al-Qadr and the Exhortation to seek it; When it is and the most likely times to seek it

name_ar: باب اعْتِكَافِ الْعَشْرِ الأَوَاخِرِ مِنْ رَمَضَانَ ‏
name_en: I'tikaf during the last ten days of Ramadan

name_ar: باب مَتَى يَدْخُلُ مَنْ أَرَادَ الاِعْتِكَافَ فِي مُعْتَكَفِهِ ‏
name_en: When should the one who wants to observe I'tikaf enter his place of I'tikaf?

name_ar: باب الاِجْتِهَادِ فِي الْعَشْرِ الأَوَاخِرِ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ ‏
name_en: Striving harder in worship during the last ten days of Ramadan

name_ar: باب صَوْمِ عَشْرِ ذِي الْحِجَّةِ ‏
name_en: Fasting the (first) ten days of Dhul Hijjah

name_ar: باب مَا يُبَاحُ لِلْمُحْرِمِ بِحَجٍّ أَوْ عُمْرَةٍ وَمَا لاَ يُبَاحُ وَبَيَانِ تَحْرِيمِ الطِّيبِ عَلَيْهِ
name_en: What one who has entered Ihram for Hajj or Umrah is permitted to wear, and what is not permissible, and perfume is forbidden for him

name_ar: باب مَوَاقِيتِ الْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ ‏
name_en: The Mawaqit of Hajj

name_ar: باب التَّلْبِيَةِ وَصِفَتِهَا وَوَقْتِهَا ‏
name_en: The Talbiyah, its description and timing

name_ar: باب أَمْرِ أَهْلِ الْمَدِينَةِ بِالإِحْرَامِ مِنْ عِنْدِ مَسْجِدِ ذِي الْحُلَيْفَةِ ‏
name_en: The command to the people of Al-Madinah to enter Ihram from the Masjid at Dhul-Hulaifah

name_ar: باب الإِهْلاَلِ مِنْ حَيْثُ تَنْبَعِثُ الرَّاحِلَةُ ‏
name_en: Clarifying that it is better to enter Ihram when a person's mount sets off with him, heading towards Makkah, not straight after the two rak'ah

name_ar: باب الصَّلاَةِ فِي مَسْجِدِ ذِي الْحُلَيْفَةِ ‏
name_en: Praying at the Masjid of Dhul-Hulaifah

name_ar: باب الطِّيبِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ عِنْدَ الإِحْرَامِ ‏
name_en: It is recommended to apply perfume just before entering Ihram, and it is recommended to use Musk, and it does not matter if its glistening traces remain

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الصَّيْدِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ
name_en: The prohibition of hunting game for the one who has entered Ihram for Hajj or for Umrah or for both

name_ar: باب مَا يُنْدَبُ لِلْمُحْرِمِ وَغَيْرِهِ قَتْلُهُ مِنَ الدَّوَابِّ فِي الْحِلِّ وَالْحَرَمِ ‏
name_en: What animals it is recommended for the Muhrim and others to kill inside and outside the Sanctuary

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ حَلْقِ الرَّأْسِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ إِذَا كَانَ بِهِ أَذًى وَوُجُوبِ الْفِدْيَةِ لِحَلْقِهِ وَبَيَانِ قَدْرِهَا
name_en: It is permissible for a Muhrim to shave his head if there is a problem, but it is obligatory to offer a Fidyah for shaving it, and Clarifying what the Fidyah is

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ الْحِجَامَةِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ ‏
name_en: Cupping is permissible for the Muhrim (pilgrim in Ihram)

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ مُدَاوَاةِ الْمُحْرِمِ عَيْنَيْهِ ‏
name_en: It is permissible for a Muhrim to treat his eyes

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ غَسْلِ الْمُحْرِمِ بَدَنَهُ وَرَأْسَهُ ‏
name_en: It is permissible for the Muhrim to wash his body and head

name_ar: باب مَا يُفْعَلُ بِالْمُحْرِمِ إِذَا مَاتَ ‏
name_en: What should be done with a Muhrim if he dies?

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ اشْتِرَاطِ الْمُحْرِمِ التَّحَلُّلَ بِعُذْرِ الْمَرَضِ وَنَحْوِهِ ‏
name_en: It is permissible for the Muhrim to stipulate a condition for exiting Ihram because of sickness and the like

name_ar: باب إِحْرَامِ النُّفَسَاءِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ اغْتِسَالِهَا لِلإِحْرَامِ وَكَذَا الْحَائِضِ ‏
name_en: The soundness of Ihram for the woman in Nifas; It is recommended for her to perform Ghusl before entering Ihram, and the same applies to one who is menstruating

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ وُجُوهِ الإِحْرَامِ وَأَنَّهُ يَجُوزُ إِفْرَادُ الْحَجِّ وَالتَّمَتُّعِ وَالْقِرَانِ وَجَوَازِ إِدْخَالِ الْحَجِّ عَلَى الْعُمْرَةِ وَمَتَى يَحِلُّ الْقَارِنُ مِنْ نُسُكِهِ
name_en: Clarifying the types of Ihram; and that it is permissible to perform Hajj that is Ifrad, Tamattu and Qiran. It is permissible to join Hajj to Umrah. And when the pilgrim who is performing Qiran should exit Ihram

name_ar: باب فِي الْمُتْعَةِ بِالْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ ‏
name_en: Tamattu with Hajj and Umrah

name_ar: باب حَجَّةِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم ‏
name_en: The Hajj of the Prophet ﷺ

name_ar: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ عَرَفَةَ كُلَّهَا مَوْقِفٌ ‏
name_en: All of Arafat is a place of standing

name_ar: باب فِي الْوُقُوفِ وَقَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى ‏{‏ ثُمَّ أَفِيضُوا مِنْ حَيْث أَفَاضَ النَّاسُ}
name_en: The Standing and the Saying of Allah, The Most High: "Then depart from the place whence all the people depart"

name_ar: باب فِي نَسْخِ التَّحَلُّلِ مِنَ الإِحْرَامِ وَالأَمْرِ بِالتَّمَامِ ‏
name_en: It is permissible to base one's intention for Ihram on the intention of another

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ التَّمَتُّعِ
name_en: The Permissibility of Tamattu'

name_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الدَّمِ عَلَى الْمُتَمَتِّعِ وَأَنَّهُ إِذَا عَدِمَهُ لَزِمَهُ صَوْمُ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ فِي الْحَجِّ وَسَبْعَةٍ إِذَا رَجَعَ إِلَى أَهْلِهِ
name_en: The Obligation For the Pilgrim who is performing Tamattu' to offer a sacrifice; If he has no animal to sacrifice, he must fast for three days during Hajj and seven days when he goes back to his family

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الْقَارِنَ لاَ يَتَحَلَّلُ إِلاَّ فِي وَقْتِ تَحَلُّلِ الْحَاجِّ الْمُفْرِدِ ‏
name_en: The pilgrim performing Qiran should not exit Ihram except when the pilgrims performing Ifrad exit Ihram

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ جَوَازِ التَّحَلُّلِ بِالإِحْصَارِ وَجَوَازِ الْقِرَانِ ‏
name_en: It is permissible to exit Ihram if one is prevented from completing Hajj; It is permissible to perform Qiran and the pilgrim performing Qiran should perform just one Tawaf and one Sa'i

name_ar: باب فِي الإِفْرَادِ وَالْقِرَانِ بِالْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ ‏
name_en: Ifrad and Qiran

name_ar: باب مَا يَلْزَمُ مَنْ أَحْرَمَ بِالْحَجِّ ثُمَّ قَدِمَ مَكَّةَ مِنَ الطَّوَافِ وَالسَّعْىِ ‏
name_en: It is recommended for the pilgrim to perform Tawaf Al-Qudum and As-Sa'i after it

name_ar: باب مَا يَلْزَمُ مَنْ طَافَ بِالْبَيْتِ وَسَعَى مِنَ الْبَقَاءِ عَلَى الإِحْرَامِ وَتَرْكِ التَّحَلُّلِ ‏
name_en: Clarifying that the pilgrim who has entered Ihram for Umrah should not exit Ihram after performing Tawaf before Sa'i; And the pilgrim who has entered Ihram for Hajj should not exit Ihram after performing Tawaf Al-Qudum, and the same applies to the pilgrim performing Qiran

name_ar: باب فِي مُتْعَةِ الْحَجِّ ‏
name_en: Tamattu' in Hajj

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ الْعُمْرَةِ فِي أَشْهُرِ الْحَجِّ ‏
name_en: It is permissible to perform 'Umrah during the months of Hajj

name_ar: باب تَقْلِيدِ الْهَدْىِ وَإِشْعَارِهِ عِنْدَ الإِحْرَامِ ‏
name_en: Marking and Garlanding the sacrificial animal when entering Ihram

name_ar: باب التَّقْصِيرِ فِي الْعُمْرَةِ ‏
name_en: It is permissible for the pilgrim performing Umrah to shorten his hair and he does not have to shave it. It is recommended for him to shave his hair or shorten it at Al-Marwah

name_ar: باب إِهْلاَلِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَهَدْيِهِ ‏
name_en: The Ihram and Hadi of the Prophet (ﷺ)

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ عَدَدِ عُمَرِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَزَمَانِهِنَّ ‏
name_en: The number of Umrahs performed by the prophet (ﷺ) and when he performed them

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْعُمْرَةِ فِي رَمَضَانَ ‏
name_en: The virtue of the Umrah performed during Ramadan

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ دُخُولِ مَكَّةَ مِنَ الثَّنِيَّةِ الْعُلْيَا وَالْخُرُوجِ مِنْهَا مِنَ الثَّنِيَّةِ السُّفْلَى وَدُخُولِ بَلْدَةٍ مِنْ طَرِيقٍ غَيْرِ الَّتِي خَرَجَ مِنْهَا
name_en: It is recommended to enter Makkah from the Upper Mountain Pass and to leave from the Lower Mountain Pass; Entering a city via a route different than the one by which you leave it

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الْمَبِيتِ بِذِي طَوًى عِنْدَ إِرَادَةِ دُخُولِ مَكَّةَ وَالاِغْتِسَالِ لِدُخُولِهَا نَهَارًا
name_en: It is recommended to stay overnight in Dhu Tuwa when intending to enter Makkah, and to perform Ghusl before entering it, and to enter it by day

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الرَّمَلِ فِي الطَّوَافِ وَالْعُمْرَةِ وَفِي الطَّوَافِ الأَوَّلِ فِي الْحَجِّ ‏
name_en: Raml (walking rapidly) is recommended in the Tawaf of Umrah, and in the first Tawaf of Hajj

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ اسْتِلاَمِ الرُّكْنَيْنِ الْيَمَانِيَيْنِ فِي الطَّوَافِ دُونَ الرُّكْنَيْنِ الآخَرَيْن
name_en: It is recommended to touch the two Yemeni Corners in Tawaf and not the other two corners

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ تَقْبِيلِ الْحَجَرِ الأَسْوَدِ فِي الطَّوَافِ ‏
name_en: It is recommended to kiss the black stone during circumambulation (Tawaf)

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ الطَّوَافِ عَلَى بَعِيرٍ وَغَيْرِهِ وَاسْتِلاَمِ الْحَجَرِ بِمِحْجَنٍ وَنَحْوِهِ لِلرَّاكِبِ
name_en: It is permissible to circumambulate the Ka'bah on a camel and the like, And for one who is riding to touch the (black) stone with a crooked staff and the like.

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ السَّعْىَ بَيْنَ الصَّفَا وَالْمَرْوَةِ رُكْنٌ لاَ يَصِحُّ الْحَجُّ إِلاَّ بِهِ ‏
name_en: Clarifying that Sa'i between As-safa and Al-Marwah is a pillar of Hajj, without which Hajj is not valid

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ السَّعْىَ لاَ يُكَرَّرُ ‏
name_en: Clarifying that Sa'i should not be repeated

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ إِدَامَةِ الْحَاجِّ التَّلْبِيَةَ حَتَّى يَشْرَعَ فِي رَمْىِ جَمْرَةِ الْعَقَبَةِ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ
name_en: It is recommended for the pilgrim to continue reciting the Talbiyah until he starts stoning Jamarat Al-'Aqabah on the day of sacrifice

name_ar: باب التَّلْبِيَةِ وَالتَّكْبِيرِ فِي الذِّهَابِ مِنْ مِنًى إِلَى عَرَفَاتٍ فِي يَوْمِ عَرَفَةَ ‏
name_en: The Talbiyah and the Takbir when going from Mina to 'Arafat on the day of 'Arafat

name_ar: باب الإِفَاضَةِ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ إِلَى الْمُزْدَلِفَةِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ صَلاَتَىِ الْمَغْرِبِ وَالْعِشَاءِ جَمْعًا بِالْمُزْدَلِفَةِ فِي هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ
name_en: Departing from 'Arafat to Al-Muzdalifah. It is recommended to pray Maghrib and 'Isha together in Al-Muzdalifah on this night

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ زِيَادَةِ التَّغْلِيسِ بِصَلاَةِ الصُّبْحِ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ بِالْمُزْدَلِفَةِ وَالْمُبَالَغَةِ فِيهِ بَعْدَ تَحَقُّقِ طُلُوعِ الْفَجْرِ
name_en: It is recommended to pray Subh when it is still dark on the day of sacrifice in Al-Muzdalifah, and to do it very early after ascertaining that dawn has broken

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ تَقْدِيمِ دَفْعِ الضَّعَفَةِ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ وَغَيْرِهِنَّ مِنْ مُزْدَلِفَةَ إِلَى مِنًى فِي أَوَاخِرِ اللَّيَالِي قَبْلَ زَحْمَةِ النَّاسِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ الْمُكْثِ لِغَيْرِهِمْ حَتَّى يُصَلُّوا الصُّبْحَ بِمُزْدَلِفَةَ
name_en: It is recommended to send the weak among women and others ahead from Al-Muzdalifah to Mina at the end of the night, before it gets crowded, but it is recommended for others to stay there until they have prayed Subh in Al-Muzdalifah

name_ar: باب رَمْىِ جَمْرَةِ الْعَقَبَةِ مِنْ بَطْنِ الْوَادِي وَتَكُونُ مَكَّةُ عَنْ يَسَارِهِ وَيُكَبِّرُ مَعَ كُلِّ حَصَاةٍ
name_en: Stoning Jamarat Al-'Aqabah from the bottom of the valley; Makkah should be on to one's left and one should say Takbir with each throw

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ رَمْىِ جَمْرَةِ الْعَقَبَةِ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ رَاكِبًا وَبَيَانِ قَوْلِهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ تَعَالَى عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: «لِتَأْخُذُوا مَنَاسِكَكُمْ»
name_en: It is recommended to stone Jamarat Al-'Aqabah, on the day of sacrifice, riding, and the prophet ﷺ said: "Learn your rituals (of Hajj) from me"

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ كَوْنِ حَصَى الْجِمَارِ بِقَدْرِ حَصَى الْخَذْفِ ‏
name_en: It is recommended for the pebbles used for stoning to be the size of broad beans

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ وَقْتِ اسْتِحْبَابِ الرَّمْىِ ‏
name_en: The time when it is recommended to stone the Jamrah

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ حَصَى الْجِمَارِ سَبْعٌ ‏
name_en: The number of pebbles for stoning the Jamrahs is seven at a time

name_ar: باب تَفْضِيلِ الْحَلْقِ عَلَى التَّقْصِيرِ وَجَوَازِ التَّقْصِيرِ ‏‏
name_en: Shaving the head is preferable to cutting the hair, although cutting the hair is permissible

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ السُّنَّةَ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ أَنْ يَرْمِيَ ثُمَّ يَنْحَرَ ثُمَّ يَحْلِقَ وَالاِبْتِدَاءِ فِي الْحَلْقِ بِالْجَانِبِ الأَيْمَنِ مِنْ رَأْسِ الْمَحْلُوقِ
name_en: The Sunnah on the day of sacrifice is to stone the Jamrah, then offer the sacrifice, then shave the head, and shaving should be started on the right side of the head

name_ar: باب مَنْ حَلَقَ قَبْلَ النَّحْرِ أَوْ نَحَرَ قَبْلَ الرَّمْىِ ‏‏
name_en: It is permissible to offer the sacrifice before stoning the Jamrah, or to shave before offering the sacrifice or stoning the Jamrah, or to perform Tawaf before any of them

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ طَوَافِ الإِفَاضَةِ يَوْمَ النَّحْرِ ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended to perform Tawaf Al-Ifadah on the day of sacrifice

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ النُّزُولِ بِالْمُحَصَّبِ يَوْمَ النَّفْرِ وَالصَّلاَةِ بِهِ ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended to halt at Al-Muhassab on the day of departing from Mina and to perform Zuhr and subsequent prayers there

name_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الْمَبِيتِ بِمِنًى لَيَالِيَ أَيَّامِ التَّشْرِيقِ وَالتَّرْخِيصِ فِي تَرْكِهِ لأَهْلِ السِّقَايَةِ
name_en: It is obligatory to stay overnight in Mina during the nights of the days of At-Tashriq, and the concession allowing those who supply water to leave

name_ar: باب فِي الصَّدَقَةِ بِلُحُومِ الْهَدْىِ وَجُلُودِهَا وَجِلاَلِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Giving the meat, skin and blankets of the Hadi in charity; the butcher should not be given any of it; It is permissible to delegate someone else to offer the sacrifice

name_ar: باب الاِشْتِرَاكِ فِي الْهَدْىِ وَإِجْزَاءِ الْبَقَرَةِ وَالْبَدَنَةِ كُلٍّ مِنْهُمَا عَنْ سَبْعَةٍ ‏‏
name_en: It is permissible to share in the sacrifice, and a camel or a cow is sufficient for seven people

name_ar: باب نَحْرِ الْبُدْنِ قِيَامًا مُقَيَّدَةً ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended to sacrifice the camel when it is standing and tied

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ بَعْثِ الْهَدْىِ إِلَى الْحَرَمِ لِمَنْ لاَ يُرِيدُ الذَّهَابَ بِنَفْسِهِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ تَقْلِيدِهِ وَفَتْلِ الْقَلاَئِدِ وَأَنَّ بَاعِثَهُ لاَ يَصِيرُ مُحْرِمًا وَلاَ يَحْرُمُ عَلَيْهِ شيء بِذَلِكَ
name_en: It is recommended to send the sacrificial animal to the Haram for one who does not intend to go there himself; It is recommended to garland it and to make the garland, but the one who sends it does not enter a state of Ihram, and nothing is forbidden to him because of that

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ رُكُوبِ الْبَدَنَةِ الْمُهْدَاةِ لِمَنِ احْتَاجَ إِلَيْهَا ‏‏
name_en: It is permissible to ride the sacrificial animal if necessary

name_ar: باب مَا يُفْعَلُ بِالْهَدْىِ إِذَا عَطِبَ فِي الطَّرِيقِ ‏‏
name_en: What should be done with the sacrificial animal if it gets injured on the way?

name_ar: باب وُجُوبِ طَوَافِ الْوَدَاعِ وَسُقُوطِهِ عَنِ الْحَائِضِ
name_en: The farewell Tawaf is obligatory, but it is waived in the case of menstruating women

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ دُخُولِ الْكَعْبَةِ لِلْحَاجِّ وَغَيْرِهِ وَالصَّلاَةِ فِيهَا وَالدُّعَاءِ فِي نَوَاحِيهَا كُلِّهَا
name_en: It is recommended for pilgrims and others to enter the Ka'bah and pray therein, and supplicate in all its corners

name_ar: باب نَقْضِ الْكَعْبَةِ وَبِنَائِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Demolishing the Ka'bah and rebuilding it

name_ar: باب جَدْرِ الْكَعْبَةِ وَبَابِهَا ‏‏
name_en: The wall and the door of the Ka'bah

name_ar: باب الْحَجِّ عَنِ الْعَاجِزِ، لِزَمَانَةٍ وَهِرَمٍ وَنَحْوِهِمَا أَوْ لِلْمَوْتِ ‏‏
name_en: Hajj on behalf of one who is incapable of doing it because of chronic illness, old age and the like, or on behalf of one who has died

name_ar: باب صِحَّةِ حَجِّ الصَّبِيِّ وَأَجْرِ مَنْ حَجَّ بِهِ ‏‏
name_en: Validity of a child's hajj, and the reward of the one who takes him for Hajj

name_ar: باب فَرْضِ الْحَجِّ مَرَّةً فِي الْعُمْرِ ‏‏
name_en: Hajj is obligatory once in a lifetime

name_ar: باب سَفَرِ الْمَرْأَةِ مَعَ مَحْرَمٍ إِلَى حَجٍّ وَغَيْرِهِ ‏‏
name_en: A woman travelling with a Mahram for Hajj and other purposes

name_ar: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا رَكِبَ إِلَى سَفَرٍ الْحَجِّ وَغَيْرِهِ ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended to recite statements of remembrance when setting out for Hajj or any other purpose, and the best of this remembrances

name_ar: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا قَفَلَ مِنْ سَفَرٍ الْحَجِّ وَغَيْرِهِ ‏‏
name_en: What should be said when returning from Hajj and other journeys

name_ar: باب التَّعْرِيسِ بِذِي الْحُلَيْفَةِ وَالصَّلاَةِ بِهَا إِذَا صَدَرَ مِنَ الْحَجِّ أَوِ الْعُمْرَةِ ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended to stop in Batha' of Dhul-Hulaifah and pray there when departing from Hajj and 'Umrah, or any time one passes through it

name_ar: باب لاَ يَحُجُّ الْبَيْتَ مُشْرِكٌ وَلاَ يَطُوفُ بِالْبَيْتِ عُرْيَانٌ وَبَيَانُ يَوْمِ الْحَجِّ الأَكْبَبَرِ
name_en: No idolater may circumambulate the house, and no one may circumambulate the house naked, and when the greatest day of Hajj is

name_ar: باب فِي فَضْلِ الْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ وَيَوْمِ عَرَفَةَ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of the day of 'Arafat

name_ar: باب النُّزُولِ بِمَكَّةَ لِلْحَاجِّ وَتَوْرِيثِ دُورِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Pilgrims staying in Makkah, and Inheriting its houses

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ الإِقَامَةِ بِمَكَّةَ لِلْمُهَاجِرِ مِنْهَا بَعْدَ فَرَاغِ الْحَجِّ وَالْعُمْرَةِ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ بِلاَ زِيَادَةٍ
name_en: It is permissible for the one who emigrated from Makkah to stay there for three days after completing Hajj and 'Umrah, and no more than that

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ مَكَّةَ وَصَيْدِهَا وَخَلاَهَا وَشَجَرِهَا وَلُقَطَتِهَا إِلاَّ لِمُنْشِدٍ عَلَى الدَّوَام
name_en: The sanctity of Makkah and the sanctity of its game, grasses, trees and lost property, except for the one who announces it, is forever

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ حَمْلِ السِّلاَحِ، بِمَكَّةَ بِلاَ حَاجَةٍ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of carrying weapons in Makkah when there is no need for that

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ دُخُولِ مَكَّةَ بِغَيْرِ إِحْرَامٍ ‏‏
name_en: It is permissible to enter Makkah without Ihram

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْمَدِينَةِ وَدُعَاءِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فِيهَا بِالْبَرَكَةِ وَبَيَانِ تَحْرِيمِها وَتَحْرِيمِ صَيْدِهَا وَشَجَرِهَا وَبَيَانِ حُدُودِ حَرَمِهَا
name_en: The virtue of Al-Madinah and the Prophet's Prayer for it to be blessed. Its sanctity and the sanctity of its game and trees. The Boundaries of its sanctuary

name_ar: باب التَّرْغِيبِ فِي سُكْنَى الْمَدِينَةِ وَالصَّبْرِ عَلَى لأْوَائِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Encouragement to live in Al-Madinah and to be patient on bearing its distress and hardships

name_ar: باب صِيَانَةِ الْمَدِينَةِ مِنْ دُخُولِ الطَّاعُونِ وَالدَّجَّالِ إِلَيْهَا ‏‏
name_en: Al-Madinah is protected against the plague and the Dajjal entering it

name_ar: باب الْمَدِينَةِ تَنْفِي شِرَارَهَا ‏‏
name_en: Al-Madinah eliminates its Dross and it is also called Tabah, and Taibah

name_ar: باب مَنْ أَرَادَ أَهْلَ الْمَدِينَةِ بِسُوءٍ أَذَابَهُ اللَّهُ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of wishing ill towards the people of Al-Madinah, and that the one who wishes them ill will be caused to melt by Allah

name_ar: باب التَّرْغِيبِ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ عِنْدَ فَتْحِ الأَمْصَارِ ‏‏
name_en: Encouraging people to stay in Al-Madinah when the regions were conquered

name_ar: باب فِي الْمَدِينَةِ حِينَ يَتْرُكُهَا أَهْلُهَا ‏‏
name_en: The Prophet ﷺ foretold that the people will abandon Al-Madinah when it is the best it ever was

name_ar: باب مَا بَيْنَ الْقَبْرِ وَالْمِنْبَرِ رَوْضَةٌ مِنْ رِيَاضِ الْجَنَّةِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of the area between the prophet's grave and his Minbar, and the virtue of the spot where his minbar is

name_ar: باب أُحُدٌ جَبَلٌ يُحِبُّنَا وَنُحِبُّهُ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of Uhud

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الصَّلاَةِ بِمَسْجِدَىْ مَكَّةَ وَالْمَدِينَةِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of praying in the Masajid of Makkah and Al-Madinah

name_ar: باب لاَ تُشَدُّ الرِّحَالُ إِلاَّ إِلَى ثَلاَثَةِ مَسَاجِدَ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of the Three Masajid

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ الْمَسْجِدَ الَّذِي أُسِّسَ عَلَى التَّقْوَى هُوَ مَسْجِدُ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم بِالْمَدِينَةِ
name_en: The Masjid whose foundation was founded upon piety is the Masjid of the Prophet ﷺ in Al-Madinah

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ مَسْجِدِ قُبَاءٍ وَفَضْلِ الصَّلاَةِ فِيهِ وَزِيَارَتِهِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of the Masjid of Quba', and the virtue of praying therein and visiting it

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ النِّكَاحِ لِمَنْ تَاقَتْ نَفْسُهُ إِلَيْهِ وَوَجَدَ مُؤْنَةً وَاشْتِغَالِ مَنْ عَجَزَ عَنِ الْمُؤَنِ بِالصَّوْمِ
name_en: Marriage is recommended for the one who desires it and can afford it, and the one who cannot afford it should distract himself by fasting

name_ar: باب نَدْبِ مَنْ رَأَى امْرَأَةً فَوَقَعَتْ فِي نَفْسِهِ إِلَى أَنْ يَأْتِيَ امْرَأَتَهُ أَوْ جَارِيَتَهُ فَيُوَاقِعَهَا
name_en: Recommendation to the one who sees a woman and is attracted to her, to go to his wife or slave woman and have intercourse with her

name_ar: باب نِكَاحِ الْمُتْعَةِ وَبَيَانِ أَنَّهُ أُبِيحَ ثُمَّ نُسِخَ ثُمَّ أُبِيحَ ثُمَّ نُسِخَ وَاسْتَقَرَّ تَحْرِيمُهُ إِلَى يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ
name_en: Mut'ah Marriage: It was permitted then abrogated, then permitted then abrogated, and it will remain Forbidden until the day of resurrection

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْجَمْعِ بَيْنَ الْمَرْأَةِ وَعَمَّتِهَا أَوْ خَالَتِهَا فِي النِّكَاحِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of being married to a woman and her paternal aunt or maternal aunt at the same time

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ نِكَاحِ الْمُحْرِمِ وَكَرَاهَةِ خِطْبَتِهِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of marriage for one who is in Ihram, and it is disliked for him to propose marriage

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْخِطْبَةِ عَلَى خِطْبَةِ أَخِيهِ حَتَّى يَأْذَنَ أَوْ يَتْرُكَ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of proposing marriage when one's brother has already proposed, unless he gives permission or gives up the idea

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ نِكَاحِ الشِّغَارِ وَبُطْلاَنِهِ ‏‏
name_en: Prohibition and invalidity of Shighar Marriage

name_ar: باب الْوَفَاءِ بِالشُّرُوطِ فِي النِّكَاحِ ‏‏
name_en: Fulfilling the conditions stipulated in the Marriage

name_ar: باب اسْتِئْذَانِ الثَّيِّبِ فِي النِّكَاحِ بِالنُّطْقِ وَالْبِكْرِ بِالسُّكُوتِ ‏
name_en: Seeking permission of a previously-married woman in words, and of a virgin by silence

name_ar: باب تَزْوِيجِ الأَبِ الْبِكْرَ الصَّغِيرَةَ ‏
name_en: It is permissible for a father to arrange the marriage of a young virgin

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ التَّزَوُّجِ وَالتَّزْوِيجِ فِي شَوَّالٍ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ الدُّخُولِ فِيهِ ‏
name_en: It is recommended to get married and arrange marriages in Shawwal, and it is recommended to consummate the marriage in that month

name_ar: باب نَدْبِ النَّظَرِ إِلَى وَجْهِ الْمَرْأَةِ وَكَفَّيْهَا لِمَنْ يُرِيدُ تَزَوُّجَهَا ‏
name_en: It is recommended for the one who wants to marry a woman to look at her face and hands before proposing marriage to her

name_ar: باب الصَّدَاقِ وَجَوَازِ كَوْنِهِ تَعْلِيمَ قُرْآنٍ وَخَاتَمَ حَدِيدٍ وَغَيْرَ ذَلِكَ مِنْ قَلِيلٍ وَكَثِيرٍ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ كَوْنِهِ خَمْسَمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ لِمَنْ لاَ يُجْحَفُ بِهِ
name_en: The Dowry. It is permissible for the dowry to be teaching Quran, a ring of iron or anything else, a small or large amount, And it is recommended for it to be Five Hundred Dirham

name_ar: باب فَضِيلَةِ إِعْتَاقِهِ أَمَتَهُ ثُمَّ يَتَزَوَّجُهَا ‏
name_en: The virtue of manumitting one's slave girl, then marrying her

name_ar: باب زَوَاجِ زَيْنَبَ بِنْتِ جَحْشٍ وَنُزُولِ الْحِجَابِ وَإِثْبَاتِ وَلِيمَةِ الْعُرْسِ ‏
name_en: The Marriage of Zainab Bint Jahsh, The Revelation of (the verse of) Hijab, and confirmation of the importance of the wedding feast.

name_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِإِجَابَةِ الدَّاعِي إِلَى دَعْوَةٍ ‏
name_en: The command to accept invitations

name_ar: باب لاَ تَحِلُّ الْمُطَلَّقَةُ ثَلاَثًا لِمُطَلِّقِهَا حَتَّى تَنْكِحَ زَوْجًا غَيْرَهُ وَيَطَأَهَا ثُمَّ يُفَارِقَهَا وَتَنْقَضِي عِدَّتُهَا
name_en: It is not permissible for a woman who has been thrice-divorced to return to the one who divorced her until she marries another husband who has intercourse with her, then divorces her, and she completes the 'Iddah

name_ar: باب مَا يُسْتَحَبُّ أَنْ يَقُولَهُ عِنْدَ الْجِمَاعِ ‏
name_en: What it is recommended to say when having intercourse

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ جِمَاعِهِ امْرَأَتَهُ فِي قُبُلِهَا مِنْ قُدَّامِهَا وَمِنْ وَرَائِهَا مِنْ غَيْرِ تَعَرُّضٍ لِلدُّبُرِ
name_en: It is permissible for a man to have intercourse with his wife from the front or from the back, without entering the behind

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ امْتِنَاعِهَا مِنْ فِرَاشِ زَوْجِهَا ‏
name_en: It is unlawful for the wife to refuse to come to her husband's bed

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ إِفْشَاءِ سِرِّ الْمَرْأَةِ ‏
name_en: The prohibition of disclosing a woman's secrets

name_ar: باب حُكْمِ الْعَزْلِ ‏
name_en: The ruling on coitus interruptus ('Azl)

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ وَطْءِ الْحَامِلِ الْمَسْبِيَّةِ ‏
name_en: The prohibition of intercourse with a pregnant captive woman

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ الْغِيلَةِ وَهِيَ وَطْءُ الْمُرْضِعِ وَكَرَاهَةِ الْعَزْلِ
name_en: It is permissible to have intercourse with a breastfeeding woman (Ghilah), and 'Azl is disliked

name_ar: باب يَحْرُمُ مِنَ الرَّضَاعَةِ مَا يَحْرُمُ مِنَ الْوِلاَدَةِ ‏
name_en: Breastfeeding Makes Unlawful What Birth Makes Unlawful.

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الرَّضَاعَةِ مِنْ مَاءِ الْفَحْلِ ‏
name_en: The prohibition that results from breastfeeding is related to the issue of the male

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ ابْنَةِ الأَخِ مِنَ الرَّضَاعَةِ ‏
name_en: The daughter of one's brother through breastfeeding is forbidden in marriage

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الرَّبِيبَةِ وَأُخْتِ الْمَرْأَةِ ‏
name_en: The prohibition of marriage to one's step daughter and the sister of one's wife

name_ar: باب فِي الْمَصَّةِ وَالْمَصَّتَيْنِ ‏
name_en: One or Two sucks

name_ar: باب التَّحْرِيمِ بِخَمْسِ رَضَعَاتٍ ‏
name_en: Becoming Mahram is established by Five Breastfeedings

name_ar: باب رَضَاعَةِ الْكَبِيرِ ‏
name_en: Breastfeeding an adult

name_ar: باب إِنَّمَا الرَّضَاعَةُ مِنَ الْمَجَاعَةِ
name_en: Breastfeeding is because of Hunger (meaning, during infancy)

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ وَطْءِ الْمَسْبِيَّةِ بَعْدَ الاِسْتِبْرَاءِ وَإِنْ كَانَ لَهَا زَوْجٌ انْفَسَخَ نِكَاحُهَا بِالسَّبْي
name_en: It is permissible to have intercourse with a female captive after it is established that she is not pregnant, and if she has a husband, then her marriage is annulled when she is captured

name_ar: باب الْوَلَدِ لِلْفِرَاشِ وَتَوَقِّي الشُّبُهَاتِ ‏‏
name_en: The child is for the bed and suspicion must be avoided

name_ar: باب الْعَمَلِ بِإِلْحَاقِ الْقَائِفِ الْوَلَدَ ‏‏
name_en: Detecting relationships from physical features

name_ar: باب قَدْرِ مَا تَسْتَحِقُّهُ الْبِكْرُ وَالثَّيِّبُ مِنْ إِقَامَةِ الزَّوْجِ عِنْدَهَا عَقِبَ الزِّفَافِ
name_en: How long a virgin and a previously-married woman are entitled to have the husband stay with them after marriage

name_ar: باب الْقَسْمِ بَيْنَ الزَّوْجَاتِ وَبَيَانِ أَنَّ السُّنَّةَ أَنْ تَكُونَ لِكُلِّ وَاحِدَةٍ لَيْلَةٌ مَعَ يَوْمِهَا
name_en: Dividing one's time among co-wives; The Sunnah is for each one to have one night and one day

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ هِبَتِهَا نَوْبَتَهَا لِضَرَّتِهَا ‏‏
name_en: It is permissible for a wife to give her turn to a co-wife

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ نِكَاحِ ذَاتِ الدِّينِ ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended to marry one who is religiously committed

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ نِكَاحِ الْبِكْرِ
name_en: It is recommended to marry virgins

name_ar: باب خَيْرُ مَتَاعِ الدُّنْيَا الْمَرْأَةُ الصَّالِحَةُ ‏‏
name_en: The best temporary joy of this world is a righteous woman

name_ar: باب الْوَصِيَّةِ بِالنِّسَاءِ ‏‏
name_en: Advice with regard to women

name_ar: باب لَوْلاَ حَوَّاءُ لَمْ تَخُنْ أُنْثَى زَوْجَهَا الدَّهْرَ ‏‏
name_en: Were it not for Hawa', no female would ever betray her husband

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ طَلاَقِ الْحَائِضِ بِغَيْرِ رِضَاهَا وَأَنَّهُ لَوْ خَالَفَ وَقَعَ الطَّلاَقُ وَيُؤْمَرُ بِجْعَتِهَا
name_en: The prohibition of divorcing a menstruating woman without her consent; If a man breaks this rule, it still counts as a divorce, and he should be ordered to take her back

name_ar: باب طَلاَقِ الثَّلاَثِ ‏‏
name_en: Threefold Divorce

name_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الْكَفَّارَةِ عَلَى مَنْ حَرَّمَ امْرَأَتَهُ وَلَمْ يَنْوِ الطَّلاَقَ ‏‏
name_en: Expiation must be offered by one who declares his wife to be unlawful for him but does not intend divorce thereby

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَنَّ تَخْيِيرَ امْرَأَتِهِ لاَ يَكُونُ طَلاَقًا إِلاَّ بِالنِّيَّةِ ‏‏
name_en: Giving one's wife the choice does not count as a divorce, unless it is intended as such

name_ar: باب فِي الإِيلاَءِ وَاعْتِزَالِ النِّسَاءِ وَتَخْيِيرِهِنَّ وَقَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى: {وَإِنْ تَظَاهَرَا عَلَيْهِ}
name_en: Ila', Keeping away from one's wives and giving them the choice, And the saying of Allah, The Most High: "But if you help one another against him

name_ar: باب الْمُطَلَّقَةُ ثَلاَثًا لاَ نَفَقَةَ لَهَا ‏‏
name_en: The woman who has been irrevocably divorced is not entitled to spending

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ خُرُوجِ الْمُعْتَدَّةِ الْبَائِنِ وَالْمُتَوَفَّى عَنْهَا زَوْجُهَا فِي النَّهَارِ لِحَاجَتِهَا
name_en: It is permissible for a woman who is observing 'Iddah after an irrevocable divorce or the death of her husband to go out during the day if she needs to

name_ar: باب انْقِضَاءِ عِدَّةِ الْمُتَوَفَّى عَنْهَا زَوْجُهَا وَغَيْرِهَا بِوَضْعِ الْحَمْلِ ‏‏
name_en: The 'Iddah of a woman whose husband had died, and the like, ends when she gives birth.

name_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الإِحْدَادِ فِي عِدَّةِ الْوَفَاةِ وَتَحْرِيمِهِ فِي غَيْرِ ذَلِكَ إِلاَّ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ
name_en: The Obligation to mourn during the 'Iddah following the death of one's husband, but it is forbidden to mourn for more than three days in other cases

name_ar: باب ‏
باب مَنْ أَعْتَقَ شِرْكًا لَهُ فِي عَبْدٍ ‏‏
name_en: One who frees his share of a slave

name_ar: باب ذِكْرِ سِعَايَةِ الْعَبْدِ ‏‏
name_en: A slave working to pay off the other half

name_ar: باب إِنَّمَا الْوَلاَءُ لِمَنْ أَعْتَقَ
name_en: Al-Wala' (Right of inheritance) belongs to the one who manumits the slave

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ بَيْعِ الْوَلاَءِ، وَهِبَتِهِ، ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of selling or giving away the wala'

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ تَوَلِّي الْعَتِيقِ غَيْرَ مَوَالِيهِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of a manumitted slave taking anyone as a Mawla except the one who manumitted him

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْعِتْقِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of manumitting slaves

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ عِتْقِ الْوَالِدِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of manumitting one's father

name_ar: باب إِبْطَالِ بَيْعِ الْمُلاَمَسَةِ وَالْمُنَابَذَةِ
name_en: The invalidity of Mulamasah and Munabadhah transactions

name_ar: باب بُطْلاَنِ بَيْعِ الْحَصَاةِ وَالْبَيْعِ الَّذِي فِيهِ غَرَرٌ ‏‏
name_en: The invalidity of Hasah transactions and transactions involving ambiguity

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ حَبَلِ الْحَبَلَةِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of selling Habl Al-Habalah

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الرَّجُلِ عَلَى بَيْعِ أَخِيهِ وَسَوْمِهِ عَلَى سَوْمِهِ وَتَحْرِيمِ النَّجْشِ وَتَحْرِيمِ التَّصْرِيَةِ
name_en: The prohibition of urging a buyer to cancel a purchase in order to sell him one's own goods; And urging a seller to cancel a sale already agreed upon so that one can buy the goods oneself; And the prohibition of artificially inflating prices; And the prohibition of letting milk accumulate in the udder in order to deceive the purchaser

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ تَلَقِّي الْجَلَبِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of intercepting traders

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الْحَاضِرِ لِلْبَادِي ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of the town-dweller selling on behalf of a bedouin

name_ar: باب حُكْمِ بَيْعِ الْمُصَرَّاةِ ‏‏
name_en: Ruling on selling Al-Musarrah (An animal in whose udder milk has been allowed to accumulate)

name_ar: باب بُطْلاَنِ بَيْعِ الْمَبِيعِ قَبْلَ الْقَبْضِ ‏‏
name_en: It is invalid to sell goods before taking possession of them

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ صُبْرَةِ التَّمْرِ الْمَجْهُولَةِ الْقَدْرِ بِتَمْرٍ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of selling a heap of dates the weight of which is unknown

name_ar: باب ثُبُوتِ خِيَارِ الْمَجْلِسِ لِلْمُتَبَايِعَيْنِ ‏‏
name_en: Affirming that both parties to a transaction have the option (of canceling it) while they are still together

name_ar: باب الصِّدْقِ فِي الْبَيْعِ وَالْبَيَانِ ‏‏
name_en: Honesty in selling and disclosure of defects

name_ar: باب مَنْ يُخْدَعُ فِي الْبَيْعِ ‏‏
name_en: One who is deceived in transactions

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ بَيْعِ الثِّمَارِ، قَبْلَ بُدُوِّ صَلاَحِهَا بِغَيْرِ شَرْطِ الْقَطْعِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of selling produce before its goodness appears

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الرُّطَبِ بِالتَّمْرِ إِلاَّ فِي الْعَرَايَا ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of selling fresh dates in exchange for dry dates except in the case of 'Araya

name_ar: باب مَنْ بَاعَ نَخْلاً عَلَيْهَا ثَمَرٌ ‏‏
name_en: One who sells date palms on which there are dates

name_ar: باب النَّهْيِ عَنِ الْمُحَاقَلَةِ وَالْمُزَابَنَةِ وَعَنِ الْمُخَابَرَةِ وَبَيْعِ الثَّمَرَةِ قَبْلَ بُدُوِّ صَلاَحِهَا وَعَنْ بَيْعِ الْمُعَاوَمَةِ وَهُوَ بَيْعُ السِّنِينَ
name_en: The prohibition of Muhaqalah and Muzabanah and Mukhabarah: and selling produce before its goodness appears, and Mu'awamah: which is selling years in advance

name_ar: باب كِرَاءِ الأَرْضِ ‏‏
name_en: Kira (leasing Land)

name_ar: باب كِرَاءِ الأَرْضِ بِالطَّعَامِ ‏‏
name_en: Leasing out Land (Kira) in return for food

name_ar: باب كِرَاءِ الأَرْضِ بِالذَّهَبِ وَالْوَرِقِ ‏‏
name_en: Leasing out Land (Kira) for gold and silver

name_ar: باب فِي الْمُزَارَعَةِ وَالْمُؤَاجَرَةِ ‏‏
name_en: Muzura'ah (Sharecropping) and Mu'ajarah

name_ar: باب الأَرْضِ تُمْنَحُ ‏‏
name_en: Lending Land

name_ar: باب الْمُسَاقَاةِ وَالْمُعَامَلَةِ بِجُزْءٍ مِنَ الثَّمَرِ وَالزَّرْعِ
name_en: Musaqah And Mu'amalah in return for a share of the fruit and crops

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْغَرْسِ وَالزَّرْعِ ‏‏
name_en: The Virtue of Planting and Cultivating

name_ar: باب وَضْعِ الْجَوَائِحِ ‏‏
name_en: Waiving Payment in the case of Blight

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الْوَضْعِ مِنَ الدَّيْنِ
name_en: It is recommended to waive debts

name_ar: باب مَنْ أَدْرَكَ مَا بَاعَهُ عِنْدَ الْمُشْتَرِي وَقَدْ أَفْلَسَ فَلَهُ الرُّجُوعُ فِيهِ ‏‏
name_en: If a man finds what he sold with the purchaser, who has become bankrupt, then he has the right to take it back

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ إِنْظَارِ الْمُعْسِرِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of giving more time to one who is suffering difficulty, and letting those go who are suffering difficulty and those who are well off

name_ar: بَاب تَحْرِيمِ مَطْلِ الْغَنِيِّ وَصِحَّةِ الْحَوَالَةِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ قَبُولِهَا إِذَا أُحِيلَ عَلَى مَلِيٍّ
name_en: The prohibition of a rich man delaying repayment. The validity of Hawalah (Transferal of Debts) and it is recommended to accept transferal of a debt if it is transferred to a rich man

name_ar: بَاب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ فَضْلِ الْمَاءِ الَّذِي يَكُونُ بِالْفَلَاةِ وَيُحْتَاجُ إِلَيْهِ لِرَعْيِ الْكَلَأِ وَتَحْرِيمِ مَنْعِ بَذْلِهِ وَتَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ ضِرَابِ الْفَحْلِ
name_en: The prohibition of selling surplus water which is in the wilderness and is needed to take care of the pasture. The prohibition of not allowing others to use it. The prohibition of Stud fees

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ ثَمَنِ الْكَلْبِ وَحُلْوَانِ الْكَاهِنِ وَمَهْرِ الْبَغِيِّ وَالنَّهْىِ عَنْ بَيْعِ السِّنّ
name_en: The prohibition of the price of a dog, the fee of a fortuneteller and the payment of a prostitute, and the prohibition of selling cats

name_ar: بَاب الْأَمْرِ بِقَتْلِ الْكِلَابِ وَبَيَانِ نَسْخِهِ وَبَيَانِ تَحْرِيمِ اقْتِنَائِهَا إِلَّا لِصَيْدٍ أَوْ زَرْعٍ أَوْ مَاشِيَةٍ وَنَحْوِ ذَلِكَ
name_en: The command to kill dogs, and its abrogation. The prohibition of keeping dogs, except for hunting, farming, (herding) livestock and the like

name_ar: باب حِلِّ أُجْرَةِ الْحِجَامَةِ ‏‏
name_en: The permissibility of a cupper's earnings

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الْخَمْرِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of selling wine

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ بَيْعِ الْخَمْرِ وَالْمَيْتَةِ وَالْخِنْزِيرِ وَالأَصْنَامِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of selling wine, dead meat, pork and idols

name_ar: باب الرِّبَا ‏‏
name_en: Riba (Usury, Interest)

name_ar: باب الصَّرْفِ وَبَيْعِ الذَّهَبِ بِالْوَرِقِ نَقْدًا ‏‏
name_en: Exchange and Selling Gold for Silver on the spot

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ بَيْعِ الْوَرِقِ، بِالذَّهَبِ دَيْنًا ‏‏
name_en: The Prohibition of selling silver for gold to be paid at a later date

name_ar: باب بَيْعِ الْقِلاَدَةِ فِيهَا خَرَزٌ وَذَهَبٌ ‏‏
name_en: Selling a necklace in which there are pearls and gold

name_ar: باب بَيْعِ الطَّعَامِ مِثْلاً بِمِثْلٍ ‏‏
name_en: Selling Food Like for Like

name_ar: باب لَعْنِ آكِلِ الرِّبَا وَمُؤْكِلِهِ ‏‏
name_en: Cursing the one who consumes Riba and the one who pays it

name_ar: باب أَخْذِ الْحَلاَلِ وَتَرْكِ الشُّبُهَاتِ ‏‏
name_en: Taking that which is lawful and leaving that which is unclear

name_ar: باب بَيْعِ الْبَعِيرِ وَاسْتِثْنَاءِ رُكُوبِهِ ‏‏
name_en: Selling Camels and Stipulating that one may ride them

name_ar: باب مَنِ اسْتَسْلَفَ شَيْئًا فَقَضَى خَيْرًا مِنْهُ وَ ‏"‏ خَيْرُكُمْ أَحْسَنُكُمْ قَضَاءً ‏"‏ ‏‏
name_en: It is permissible to lend animals and it is recommended to pay in full, giving something better than that which ts owed

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ بَيْعِ الْحَيَوَانِ بِالْحَيَوَانِ مِنْ جِنْسِهِ مُتَفَاضِلاً ‏‏
name_en: The permissibility of selling animals for animals of the same kind and of different quality

name_ar: باب الرَّهْنِ وَجَوَازِهِ فِي الْحَضَرِ وَالسَّفَرِ ‏‏
name_en: Pawning (Rahn) and its permissibility whether one is travelling or not

name_ar: باب السَّلَمِ ‏‏
name_en: Salam (Payment in Advance)

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الاِحْتِكَارِ فِي الأَقْوَاتِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of hoarding staple foods

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْحَلِفِ، فِي الْبَيْعِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of swearing oaths when selling

name_ar: باب الشُّفْعَةِ ‏‏
name_en: Pre-emption

name_ar: باب غَرْزِ الْخَشَبِ فِي جِدَارِ الْجَارِ ‏‏
name_en: Fixing a piece of wood to a neighbor's wall

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الظُّلْمِ وَغَصْبِ الأَرْضِ وَغَيْرِهَا ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of wrongdoing, seizing land unlawfully etc

name_ar: باب قَدْرِ الطَّرِيقِ إِذَا اخْتَلَفُوا فِيهِ ‏‏
name_en: The width of the road if there is a dispute about it

name_ar: باب أَلْحِقُوا الْفَرَائِضَ بِأَهْلِهَا فَمَا بَقِيَ فَلأَوْلَى رَجُلٍ ذَكَرٍ ‏‏
name_en: Give The Shares Of Inheritance To Those Who Are Entitled To Them, And Whatever Is Left Goes To The Closest Male Relative

name_ar: باب مِيرَاثِ الْكَلاَلَةِ ‏‏
name_en: Inheritance Of The Kalalah

name_ar: باب آخِرِ آيَةٍ أُنْزِلَتْ آيَةُ الْكَلاَلَةِ ‏‏
name_en: The Last Verse To Be Revealed Was The Verse Of Kalalah

name_ar: باب مَنْ تَرَكَ مَالاً فَلِوَرَثَتِهِ ‏‏
name_en: Whoever Leaves Behind Wealth, It Is For His Heirs

name_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ شِرَاءِ الإِنْسَانِ مَا تَصَدَّقَ بِهِ مِمَّنْ تَصَدَّقَ عَلَيْهِ ‏‏
name_en: It Is Disliked For A Man To Buy What He Gave In Charity From The One To Whom He Gave It

name_ar: بَاب تَحْرِيمِ الرُّجُوعِ فِي الصَّدَقَةِ وَالْهِبَةِ بَعْدَ الْقَبْضِ إِلَّا مَا وَهَبَهُ لِوَلَدِهِ وَإِنْ سَفَلَ
name_en: The Prohibition Of Taking Back One's Charity After It Has Been Accepted, Except In The Case Of What A Father Gives To A Son Or Grandson

name_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ تَفْضِيلِ بَعْضِ الأَوْلاَدِ فِي الْهِبَةِ ‏‏
name_en: It Is Disliked To Favor Some Of One's Children Over Others In Gift-Giving

name_ar: باب الْعُمْرَى ‏‏
name_en: The 'Umrah (Lifelong Gift)

name_ar: باب الْوَصِيَّةِ بِالثُّلُثِ ‏‏
name_en: Bequeathing One-Third

name_ar: باب وُصُولِ ثَوَابِ الصَّدَقَاتِ إِلَى الْمَيِّتِ ‏‏
name_en: The Reward For Charity Reaches The Deceased

name_ar: باب مَا يَلْحَقُ الإِنْسَانَ مِنَ الثَّوَابِ بَعْدَ وَفَاتِهِ ‏‏
name_en: What Reward Reaches A Man After His Death

name_ar: باب الْوَقْفِ ‏‏
name_en: Waqf (Endowment)

name_ar: باب تَرْكِ الْوَصِيَّةِ لِمَنْ لَيْسَ لَهُ شَىْءٌ يُوصِي فِيهِ ‏‏
name_en: Not Making A Will For One Who Has Nothing To Be Bequeathed

name_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِقَضَاءِ النَّذْرِ ‏‏
name_en: The Command To Fulfill Vows

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ النَّذْرِ، وَأَنَّهُ، لاَ يَرُدُّ شَيْئًا ‏‏
name_en: The Prohibition Of Vows, And Confirmation That They Do Not Avert Anything

name_ar: باب لاَ وَفَاءَ لِنَذْرٍ فِي مَعْصِيَةِ اللَّهِ وَلاَ فِيمَا لاَ يَمْلِكُ الْعَبْدُ ‏‏
name_en: There is no fulfillment of a vow that involves disobedience towards Allah, or a vow concerning that which a person does not own

name_ar: باب مَنْ نَذَرَ أَنْ يَمْشِيَ إِلَى الْكَعْبَةِ ‏‏
name_en: One Who Vows To Walk To The Ka'bah

name_ar: باب فِي كَفَّارَةِ النَّذْرِ ‏‏
name_en: Expiation For Breaking A Vow

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْحَلِفِ بِغَيْرِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of swearing by something other than Allah

name_ar: باب مَنْ حَلَفَ بِاللاَّتِ وَالْعُزَّى فَلْيَقُلْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ ‏‏
name_en: Whoever swears by Al-Lat and Al-Uzza, let him say La Ilaha Illallah

name_ar: باب نَدْبِ مَنْ حَلَفَ يَمِينًا فَرَأَى غَيْرَهَا خَيْرًا مِنْهَا أَنْ يَأْتِيَ الَّذِي هُوَ خَيْرٌ وَيُكَفِّرَ عَنْ يَمِينِهِ
name_en: It is recommended for the one who swears an oath then sees that something else is better than it; To do that which is better and offer expiation for his oath

name_ar: باب يَمِينِ الْحَالِفِ عَلَى نِيَّةِ الْمُسْتَحْلِفِ ‏‏
name_en: An oath is judged on the intention of the one who asks for it to be sworn.

name_ar: باب الاِسْتِثْنَاءِ ‏‏
name_en: Saying: "If Allah wills" when swearing oaths and at other times

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنِ الإِصْرَارِ، عَلَى الْيَمِينِ فِيمَا يَتَأَذَّى بِهِ أَهْلُ الْحَالِفِ مِمَّا لَيْسَ بِحَرَامٍ
name_en: The prohibition of persisting in an oath that will harm the family of the one who swears it, so long as not persisting in it does not involve anything unlawful

name_ar: باب نَذْرِ الْكَافِرِ وَمَا يَفْعَلُ فِيهِ إِذَا أَسْلَمَ ‏‏
name_en: The vow of a disbeliever, and what he should do about it if he becomes a muslim

name_ar: باب صُحْبَةِ الْمَمَالِيكِ وَكَفَّارَةِ مَنْ لَطَمَ عَبْدَهُ ‏‏
name_en: Treatment of slaves, and the expiation of one who slaps his slave

name_ar: باب التَّغْلِيظِ عَلَى مَنْ قَذَفَ مَمْلُوكَهُ بِالزِّنَا ‏‏
name_en: Stern warning against accusing a slave of fornication

name_ar: باب إِطْعَامِ الْمَمْلُوكِ مِمَّا يَأْكُلُ وَإِلْبَاسِهِ مَمَّا يَلْبَسُ وَلاَ يُكَلِّفُهُ مَا يَغْلِبُهُ
name_en: Feeding a slave what one eats and clothing him as one clothes oneself, and not burdening him with more than he bear

name_ar: باب ثَوَابِ الْعَبْدِ وَأَجْرِهِ إِذَا نَصَحَ لِسَيِّدِهِ وَأَحْسَنَ عِبَادَةَ اللَّهِ ‏‏
name_en: The reward of a slave who is sincere towards his master and worships Allah properly

name_ar: باب مَنْ أَعْتَقَ شِرْكًا لَهُ فِي عَبْدٍ ‏‏
name_en: One who frees his share in a slave

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ بَيْعِ الْمُدَبَّرِ ‏‏
name_en: Permissibility of selling a Mudabbar

name_ar: باب الْقَسَامَةِ
name_en: Qasamah (Oaths)

name_ar: باب حُكْمِ الْمُحَارِبِينَ وَالْمُرْتَدِّينَ ‏‏
name_en: The ruling on Muharibin and Apostates

name_ar: باب ثُبُوتِ الْقِصَاصِ فِي الْقَتْلِ بِالْحَجَرِ وَغَيْرِهِ مِنَ الْمُحَدَّدَاتِ وَالْمُثَقَّلاَتِ وَقَتْلِ الرَّجُلِ بِالْمَرْأَةِ
name_en: Confirmation of Qisas in the case of killing with a rock and other sharp or heavy objects, and the killing of a man for a woman

name_ar: باب الصَّائِلُ عَلَى نَفْسِ الإِنْسَانِ أَوْ عُضْوِهِ إِذَا دَفَعَهُ الْمَصُولُ عَلَيْهِ فَأَتْلَفَ نَفْسَهُ أَوْ عُضْوَهَ لاَ ضَمَانَ عَلَيْهِ
name_en: If a person attacks another person's life and limb, and the other defends himself and kills him or injures him, there is no penalty on him

name_ar: باب إِثْبَاتِ الْقِصَاصِ فِي الأَسْنَانِ وَمَا فِي مَعْنَاهَا ‏‏
name_en: The validity of Qisas for teeth and the like

name_ar: باب مَا يُبَاحُ بِهِ دَمُ الْمُسْلِمِ ‏‏
name_en: When it is permissible to shed the blood of a muslim

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ إِثْمِ مَنْ سَنَّ الْقَتْلَ ‏‏
name_en: The sin of the one who set the precedent of killing

name_ar: باب الْمُجَازَاةِ بِالدِّمَاءِ فِي الآخِرَةِ وَأَنَّهَا أَوَّلُ مَا يُقْضَى فِيهِ بَيْنَ النَّاسِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ
name_en: The punishment for bloodshed in the hereafter, and bloodshed will be the first thing concerning which judgement is passed among the people on the Day of Resurrection

name_ar: باب تَغْلِيظِ تَحْرِيمِ الدِّمَاءِ وَالأَعْرَاضِ وَالأَمْوَالِ ‏‏
name_en: Emphasis on the sanctity of Blood, Honor and Wealth

name_ar: باب صِحَّةِ الإِقْرَارِ بِالْقَتْلِ وَتَمْكِينِ وَلِيِّ الْقَتِيلِ مِنَ الْقِصَاصِ وَاسْتِحْبَابِ طَلَبِ الْعَفْوِ مِنْهُ
name_en: A confession to murder is valid and the heir of the victim is entitled to Qisas, but it is recommended to ask him to let him go

name_ar: باب دِيَةِ الْجَنِينِ وَوُجُوبِ الدِّيَةِ فِي قَتْلِ الْخَطَإِ وَشِبْهِ الْعَمْدِ عَلَى عَاقِلَةِ الْجَانِي
name_en: The Diyah for a fetus; and the Diyah for accidental killing and the ambiguous killing must be paid by the shahiqilah of the killer

name_ar: باب حَدِّ السَّرِقَةِ وَنِصَابِهَا ‏‏
name_en: The Hadd for stealing and the minimum threshold

name_ar: باب قَطْعِ السَّارِقِ الشَّرِيفِ وَغَيْرِهِ وَالنَّهْىِ عَنِ الشَّفَاعَةِ فِي الْحُدُودِ ‏‏
name_en: Cutting off the hand of a thief from the nobility and others; the prohibition of interceding with regard to Hudud punishments

name_ar: باب حَدِّ الزِّنَا ‏‏
name_en: The Hadd punishment for Zina (fornication, adultery)

name_ar: باب رَجْمِ الثَّيِّبِ فِي الزِّنَا ‏‏
name_en: Stoning of a married person for Zina

name_ar: باب مَنِ اعْتَرَفَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ بِالزِّنَا ‏‏
name_en: One who confesses to Zina

name_ar: باب رَجْمِ الْيَهُودِ أَهْلِ الذِّمَّةِ فِي الزِّنَا ‏‏
name_en: Stoning Jews and Ahl Adh-Dhimmah for Zina

name_ar: باب تَأْخِيرِ الْحَدِّ عَنِ النُّفَسَاءِ، ‏‏
name_en: Delaying the Hadd punishment in the case of women who have just given birth

name_ar: باب حَدِّ الْخَمْرِ ‏‏
name_en: Hadd punishment for drinking alcohol

name_ar: باب قَدْرِ أَسْوَاطِ التَّعْزِيرِ
name_en: Number of lashes in the case of ta'zeer

name_ar: باب الْحُدُودُ كَفَّارَاتٌ لأَهْلِهَا ‏‏
name_en: The Hadd punishments are an expiation for those on whom they are carried out

name_ar: باب جَرْحُ الْعَجْمَاءِ وَالْمَعْدِنِ وَالْبِئْرِ جُبَارٌ ‏‏
name_en: There is no Diyah for injuries caused by animals or by falling into a mine or well

name_ar: باب الْيَمِينُ عَلَى الْمُدَّعَى عَلَيْهِ ‏‏
name_en: Oath should be sworn by the defendant

name_ar: باب الْقَضَاءِ بِالْيَمِينِ وَالشَّاهِدِ ‏‏
name_en: The obligation of judging on the basis of a witness and an oath

name_ar: باب الْحُكْمِ بِالظَّاهِرِ وَاللَّحْنِ بِالْحُجَّةِ ‏‏
name_en: So the judgement of the judge does not change what happened

name_ar: باب قَضِيَّةِ هِنْدٍ ‏‏
name_en: The case of Hind

name_ar: باب النَّهْيِ عَنْ كَثْرَةِ الْمَسَائِلِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَاجَةٍ وَالنَّهْيِ عَنْ مَنْعٍ وَهَاتٍ وَهُوَ الاِمْتِنَاعُ مِنْ أَدَاءِ حَقٍّ لَزِمَهُ أَوْ طَلَبُ مَا لاَ يَسْتَحِقُّهُ
name_en: The prohibition of asking too much with no need. The prohibition of withholding the rights of others and asking of them, which means refusing to give others their rights and asking for that to which one is not entitled

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ أَجْرِ الْحَاكِمِ إِذَا اجْتَهَدَ فَأَصَابَ أَوْ أَخْطَأَ ‏‏
name_en: The reward of the judge if he strives to reach a decision, whether he gets it right or wrong

name_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ قَضَاءِ الْقَاضِي وَهُوَ غَضْبَانُ ‏‏
name_en: It is disliked for a judge to pass a judgement when he is angry

name_ar: باب نَقْضِ الأَحْكَامِ الْبَاطِلَةِ وَرَدِّ مُحْدَثَاتِ الأُمُورِ ‏‏
name_en: Rejection of wrong rulings and of newly-invented matters

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ خَيْرِ الشُّهُودِ ‏‏
name_en: The best of witnesses

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ اخْتِلاَفِ الْمُجْتَهِدِينَ ‏‏
name_en: Differences between mujtahids

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ إِصْلاَحِ الْحَاكِمِ بَيْنَ الْخَصْمَيْنِ ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended for a judge to reconcile between disputants

name_ar: باب
name_en: Picking up property lost by a pilgrim

name_ar: باب فِي لُقَطَةِ الْحَاجِّ ‏‏
name_en: Milking animals is unlawful if the owner has not given permission

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ حَلْبِ الْمَاشِيَةِ بِغَيْرِ إِذْنِ مَالِكِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Hospitality etc

name_ar: باب الضِّيَافَةِ وَنَحْوِهَا ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended to spend surplus wealth

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الْمُؤَاسَاةِ بِفُضُولِ الْمَالِ ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended to mix provisions if they are few, and to share them out

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ خَلْطِ الأَزْوَادِ إِذَا قَلَّتْ وَالْمُؤَاسَاةِ فِيهَا ‏‏
باب جَوَازِ الإِغَارَةِ عَلَى الْكُفَّارِ الَّذِينَ بَلَغَتْهُمْ دَعْوَةُ الإِسْلاَمِ مِنْ غَيْرِ تَقَدُّمِ الإِعْلاَمِ بِالإِغَارَةِ
name_en: Permissibility of raiding the Kuffar, who have been reached with the call of Islam, without giving prior warning

name_ar: باب تَأْمِيرِ الإِمَامِ الأُمَرَاءَ عَلَى الْبُعُوثِ وَوَصِيَّتِهِ إِيَّاهُمْ بِآدَابِ الْغَزْوِ وَغَيْرِهَا
name_en: Ruler appointing leaders of expeditions and advising them of the etiquette of war, etc.

name_ar: باب فِي الأَمْرِ بِالتَّيْسِيرِ وَتَرْكِ التَّنْفِيرِ
name_en: The command to show leniency and avoid causing aversion (towards Islam)

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ الْغَدْرِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of betrayal

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ الْخِدَاعِ فِي الْحَرْبِ ‏‏
name_en: Permissibility of deceit in war

name_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ تَمَنِّي لِقَاءِ الْعَدُوِّ وَالأَمْرِ بِالصَّبْرِ عِنْدَ اللِّقَاءِ ‏‏
name_en: It is disliked to wish to meet the enemy, and the command to be steadfast when meeting the enemy

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ الدُّعَاءِ بِالنَّصْرِ عِنْدَ لِقَاءِ الْعَدُوِّ ‏‏
name_en: It is recommended to pray for victory when meeting the enemy

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ قَتْلِ النِّسَاءِ وَالصِّبْيَانِ فِي الْحَرْبِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of killing women and children in war

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ قَتْلِ النِّسَاءِ وَالصِّبْيَانِ فِي الْبَيَاتِ مِنْ غَيْرِ تَعَمُّدٍ ‏‏
name_en: Permissibility of killing women and children in night raids, so long as it is not done deliberately

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ قَطْعِ أَشْجَارِ الْكُفَّارِ وَتَحْرِيقِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Permissibility of cutting down the trees of the Kuffar and burning them

name_ar: باب تَحْلِيلِ الْغَنَائِمِ لِهَذِهِ الأُمَّةِ خَاصَّةً ‏‏
name_en: War booty has been made permissible for this Ummah only

name_ar: باب الأَنْفَالِ ‏‏
name_en: Spoils of War

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْقَاقِ الْقَاتِلِ سَلَبَ الْقَتِيلِ ‏‏
name_en: The killer is entitled to the belongings of the one who is killed

name_ar: باب التَّنْفِيلِ وَفِدَاءِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ بِالأَسَارَى ‏‏
name_en: Additional rewards, and ransoming muslims in return for prisoners

name_ar: باب حُكْمِ الْفَىْءِ ‏‏
name_en: Ruling on Fai' (Booty acquired without fighting)

name_ar: باب قَوْلِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم ‏"‏ لاَ نُورَثُ مَا تَرَكْنَا فَهُوَ صَدَقَةٌ ‏"‏ ‏‏
name_en: The words of the Prophet (ﷺ): "We (Prophets) have no heirs and whatever we leave behind is charity."

name_ar: باب كَيْفِيَّةِ قِسْمَةِ الْغَنِيمَةِ بَيْنَ الْحَاضِرِينَ ‏‏
name_en: How booty is to be shared among the fighters

name_ar: باب الإِمْدَادِ بِالْمَلاَئِكَةِ فِي غَزْوَةِ بَدْرٍ وَإِبَاحَةِ الْغَنَائِمِ ‏‏
name_en: The support of the angels during the Battle of Badr, and the permissibility of the spoils

name_ar: باب رَبْطِ الأَسِيرِ وَحَبْسِهِ وَجَوَازِ الْمَنِّ عَلَيْهِ ‏‏
name_en: Tying up and detaining captives, and the permissibility of releasing them without a ransom

name_ar: باب إِجْلاَءِ الْيَهُودِ مِنَ الْحِجَازِ ‏‏
name_en: Expulsion of the Jews from the Hijaz

name_ar: باب إِخْرَاجِ الْيَهُودِ وَالنَّصَارَى مِنْ جَزِيرَةِ الْعَرَبِ ‏‏
name_en: Expulsion of Jews and Christians from the Arabian Peninsula

name_ar: باب جَوَازِ قِتَالِ مَنْ نَقَضَ الْعَهْدَ وَجَوَازِ إِنْزَالِ أَهْلِ الْحِصْنِ عَلَى حُكْمِ حَاكِمٍ عَدْلٍ أَهْلٍ لِلْحُكْمِ
name_en: Permissibility of fighting those who break a treaty; Permissibility of letting besieged people surrender, subject to the judgement of a just person who is qualified to pass judgement

name_ar: باب مَنْ لَزِمَهُ أَمْرٌ فَدَخَلَ عَلَيْهِ أَمْرٌ آخَرُ ‏‏
name_en: Hastening to fight, and giving precedence to the more urgent of two tasks when a choice must be made

name_ar: باب رَدِّ الْمُهَاجِرِينَ إِلَى الأَنْصَارِ مَنَائِحَهُمْ مِنَ الشَّجَرِ وَالثَّمَرِ حِينَ اسْتَغْنَوْا عَنْهَا بِالْفُتُوحِ
name_en: The Muhajirun returned to the Ansar the gifts of trees and fruits when they became independent of means through the conquests

name_ar: باب أَخْذِ الطَّعَامِ مِنْ أَرْضِ الْعَدُوِّ ‏‏
name_en: Permissibility of eating food seized as booty in Dar Al-Harb

name_ar: باب كِتَابِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِلَى هِرَقْلَ يَدْعُوهُ إِلَى الإِسْلاَمِ ‏‏
name_en: The Prophet (ﷺ) wrote to Heraclius, the ruler of Syria, inviting him to Islam

name_ar: باب كُتُبِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِلَى مُلُوكِ الْكُفَّارِ يَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ
name_en: The Prophet (ﷺ) wrote to the Kings of the Kuffar, inviting them to Islam

name_ar: باب فِي غَزْوَةِ حُنَيْنٍ ‏‏
name_en: The Battle of Hunain

name_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ الطَّائِفِ ‏‏
name_en: The Battle of At-Ta'if

name_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ بَدْرٍ ‏‏
name_en: The Battle of Badr

name_ar: باب فَتْحِ مَكَّةَ ‏‏
name_en: The conquest of Makkah

name_ar: باب إِزَالَةِ الأَصْنَامِ مِنْ حَوْلِ الْكَعْبَةِ ‏‏
name_en: Removal of Idols from around the Ka'bah

name_ar: باب لاَ يُقْتَلُ قُرَشِيٌّ صَبْرًا بَعْدَ الْفَتْحِ ‏‏
name_en: No man if Quraish is to be captured then killed, after the conquest

name_ar: باب صُلْحِ الْحُدَيْبِيَةِ فِي الْحُدَيْبِيَةِ ‏‏
name_en: The truce of Al-Hudaybiyah

name_ar: باب الْوَفَاءِ بِالْعَهْدِ ‏‏
name_en: Upholding Covenants

name_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ الأَحْزَابِ ‏‏
name_en: The Battle of Al-Ahzab (The Confederates)

name_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ أُحُدٍ ‏‏
name_en: The Battle of Uhud

name_ar: باب اشْتِدَادِ غَضَبِ اللَّهِ عَلَى مَنْ قَتَلَهُ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم ‏‏
name_en: The intense wrath of Allah towards the one who was killed by the messenger of Allah (ﷺ)

name_ar: باب مَا لَقِيَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم مِنْ أَذَى الْمُشْرِكِينَ وَالْمُنَافِقِينَ ‏‏
name_en: The persecution suffered by the prophet (ﷺ) at the hands of the idolaters and hypocrites

name_ar: باب فِي دُعَاءِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِلَى اللَّهِ وَصَبْرِهِ عَلَى أَذَى الْمُنَافِقِينَ
name_en: The supplication of the Prophet (ﷺ) and his steadfastness in the face of the hypocrites' persecution

name_ar: باب قَتْلِ أَبِي جَهْلٍ ‏‏
name_en: The slaying of Abu Jahl

name_ar: باب قَتْلِ كَعْبِ بْنِ الأَشْرَفِ طَاغُوتِ الْيَهُودِ ‏‏
name_en: The slaying of Ka'b Bin Al-Ashraf, the Tagut of the Jews

name_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ خَيْبَرَ ‏‏
name_en: The Battle of Khaibar

name_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ الأَحْزَابِ وَهِيَ الْخَنْدَقُ ‏‏
name_en: The Battle of Al-Ahzab (The Confederates), also known as Al-Khandaq (The Ditch)

name_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ ذِي قَرَدٍ وَغَيْرِهَا ‏‏
name_en: The Battle of Dhu Qarad and other battles

name_ar: باب قَوْلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى: {وَهُوَ الَّذِي كَفَّ أَيْدِيَهُمْ عَنْكُمْ} الآيَةَ:
name_en: The words of Allah, the Most High: "And He it is who has withheld their hands from you"

name_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ النِّسَاءِ مَعَ الرِّجَالِ ‏‏
name_en: Women participating in military expeditions with the men

name_ar: باب النِّسَاءُ الْغَازِيَاتُ يُرْضَخُ لَهُنَّ وَلاَ يُسْهَمُ وَالنَّهْىُ عَنْ قَتْلِ صِبْيَانِ أَهْلِ الْحَرْبِ
name_en: Women who take part in military expeditions are to be given a reward but not a regular share; And the prohibition of killing children of the enemy

name_ar: باب عَدَدِ غَزَوَاتِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم
name_en: The number of campaigns of the Prophet (ﷺ)

name_ar: باب غَزْوَةِ ذَاتِ الرِّقَاعِ
name_en: The campaign of Dhat Ar-Riqa

name_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الاِسْتِعَانَةِ فِي الْغَزْوِ بِكَافِرٍ
name_en: It is disliked to seek the help of a disbeliever in wars (except in cases of necessity, or if he thinks well of the Muslims)

name_ar: باب النَّاسُ تَبَعٌ لِقُرَيْشٍ وَالْخِلاَفَةُ فِي قُرَيْشٍ ‏‏
name_en: The people follow the Quraish and the Caliphate belongs to the Quraish

name_ar: باب الاِسْتِخْلاَفِ وَتَرْكِهِ ‏‏
name_en: Appointing a successor or not doing so

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ عَنْ طَلَبِ الإِمَارَةِ، وَالْحِرْصِ، عَلَيْهَا ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of seeking or desiring a position of authority

name_ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الإِمَارَةِ بِغَيْرِ ضَرُورَةٍ ‏‏
name_en: It is disliked to be appointed to a position of authority unnecessarily

name_ar: باب فَضِيلَةِ الإِمَامِ الْعَادِلِ وَعُقُوبَةِ الْجَائِرِ وَالْحَثِّ عَلَى الرِّفْقِ بِالرَّعِيَّةِ وَالنَّهْيِ عَنْ إِدْخَالِ الْمَشَقَّةِ عَلَيْهِمْ
name_en: The virtue of a just ruler and the punishment of a tyrant; Encouragement to treat those under one's authority with kindness and the prohibition against causing them hardship

name_ar: باب غِلَظِ تَحْرِيمِ الْغُلُولِ ‏‏
name_en: Emphatic prohibition against stealing from the spoils of war (Ghulul)

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ هَدَايَا الْعُمَّالِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition of giving gifts to agents

name_ar: باب وُجُوبِ طَاعَةِ الأُمَرَاءِ فِي غَيْرِ مَعْصِيَةٍ وَتَحْرِيمِهَا فِي الْمَعْصِيَةِ ‏‏
name_en: The obligation of obeying leaders in matters that do not involve sin, but it is forbidden to obey them in sinful matters

name_ar: باب فِي الإِمَامِ إِذَا أَمَرَ بِتَقْوَى اللَّهِ وَعَدَلَ كَانَ لَهُ أَجْرٌ ‏‏
name_en: The ruler is a shield from behind whom they fight and by whom they are protected

name_ar: باب الْوَفَاءِ بِبَيْعَةِ الْخُلَفَاءِ الأَوَّلِ فَالأَوَّلِ ‏‏
name_en: The obligation of fulfilling oaths of allegiance is owed to the first of two Caliphs

name_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِالصَّبْرِ عِنْدَ ظُلْمِ الْوُلاَةِ وَاسْتِئْثَارِهِمْ ‏‏
name_en: The command to be patient in the face of oppressive rulers and their selfishness

name_ar: باب فِي طَاعَةِ الأُمَرَاءِ وَإِنْ مَنَعُوا الْحُقُوقَ
name_en: Obeying Rulers even if they withhold the people's rights

name_ar: باب الأَمْرِ بِلُزُومِ الْجَمَاعَةِ عِنْدَ ظُهُورِ الْفِتَنِ وَتَحْذِيرِ الدُّعَاةِ إِلَى الْكُفْرِ ‏‏
name_en: The obligation of staying with the Jama'ah (main body) of the muslims when Fitan (tribulations) appear, and in all circumstances. The prohibition of refusing to obey and on splitting away from the Jama'ah

name_ar: باب حُكْمِ مَنْ فَرَّقَ أَمْرَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ وَهُوَ مُجْتَمِعٌ ‏‏
name_en: The ruling on one who seeks to divide the muslims when they are united

name_ar: باب إِذَا بُويِعَ لِخَلِيفَتَيْنِ ‏‏
name_en: When allegiance has been sworn to two caliphs

name_ar: باب وُجُوبِ الإِنْكَارِ عَلَى الأُمَرَاءِ فِيمَا يُخَالِفُ الشَّرْعَ وَتَرْكِ قِتَالِهِمْ مَا صَلَّوْا وَنَحْوِ ذَلِكَ
name_en: The obligation to denounce rulers for that in which they go against Shari'ah, but they should not be fought so long as they pray regularly, etc

name_ar: باب خِيَارِ الأَئِمَّةِ وَشِرَارِهِمْ ‏‏
name_en: The best and worst of rulers

name_ar: باب اسْتِحْبَابِ مُبَايَعَةِ الإِمَامِ الْجَيْشَ عِنْدَ إِرَادَةِ الْقِتَالِ وَبَيَانِ بَيْعَةِ الرِّضْوَانِ تَحْتَ الشَّجَرَةِ
name_en: It is recommended for the army to swear allegiance to the ruler when intending to fight, and an account of Bay'at Ar-Ridwan beneath the tree

name_ar: باب تَحْرِيمِ رُجُوعِ الْمُهَاجِرِ إِلَى اسْتِيطَانِ وَطَنِهِ ‏‏
name_en: The prohibition against a Muhajir returning to settle in his former homeland

name_ar: باب الْمُبَايَعَةِ بَعْدَ فَتْحِ مَكَّةَ عَلَى الإِسْلاَمِ وَالْجِهَادِ وَالْخَيْرِ وَبَيَانِ مَعْنَى: «لاَ هِجْرَةَ بَعْدَ الْفَتْحِ»
name_en: Swearing Allegiance and Pledging to adhere to Islam, to engage in Jihad and to do Good, after the conquest of Makkah, and the meaning of the phrase: "There is No Hijrah (migration) after the Conquest."

name_ar: باب كَيْفِيَّةِ بَيْعَةِ النِّسَاءِ ‏‏
name_en: How women gave their oath of allegiance

name_ar: باب الْبَيْعَةِ عَلَى السَّمْعِ وَالطَّاعَةِ فِيمَا اسْتَطَاعَ ‏‏
name_en: Oath of allegiance pledging to hear and obey as much as possible

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ سِنِّ الْبُلُوغِ ‏‏
name_en: The age of responsibility

name_ar: باب النَّهْىِ أَنْ يُسَافَرَ بِالْمُصْحَفِ إِلَى أَرْضِ الْكُفَّارِ إِذَا خِيفَ وُقُوعُهُ بِأَيْدِيهِمْ
name_en: The prohibition of travelling with the Mushaf to the land of the disbelievers if there is the fear that it may fall into their hands.

name_ar: باب الْمُسَابَقَةِ بَيْنَ الْخَيْلِ وَتَضْمِيرِهَا ‏‏
name_en: Horse Races and Training Horses for Racing

name_ar: باب الْخَيْلُ فِي نَوَاصِيهَا الْخَيْرُ إِلَى يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of horses; "Goodness is tied to their Forelocks."

name_ar: باب مَا يُكْرَهُ مِنْ صِفَاتِ الْخَيْلِ ‏‏
name_en: Disliked qualities in Horses

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْجِهَادِ وَالْخُرُوجِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of Jihad and going out (to fight) in the cause of Allah

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الشَّهَادَةِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of Martyrdom in the cause of Allah

name_ar: باب فَضْلِ الْغَدْوَةِ وَالرَّوْحَةِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ‏‏
name_en: The virtue of going out in the morning or the evening in the cause of Allah

name_ar: باب بَيَانِ مَا أَعَدَّهُ اللَّهُ تَعَالَى لِلْمُجَاهِدِ فِي الْجَنَّةِ مِنَ الدَّرَجَاتِ ‏‏
name_en: The High Positions that Allah has prepared for the Mujahid in Paradise

name_ar: باب مَنْ قُتِلَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ كُفِّرَتْ خَطَايَاهُ إِلاَّ الدَّيْنَ ‏‏
name_en: If a person is killed in the cause of Allah, all his sins will be expiated except debt
